Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 015-2015-VIVIENDA ─ Código Técnico de Construcción Sostenible (CTCS), respecto a la eficiencia energética.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Código Técnico de Construcción Sostenible (CTCS), que tiene por objeto normar los criterios técnicos para el diseño y construcción de edificaciones y ciudades, a fin de que sean calificadas como edificación sostenible o ciudad sostenible. La norma es de aplicación opcional en el ámbito nacional para los procesos constructivos a nivel edificatorio y a nivel urbano, es decir que se aplica a edificaciones y ciudades nuevas, cualquiera sea el sector al que pertenece, público o privado. La norma establece los requisitos técnicos de la eficiencia energética y de la transmitancia térmica de cerramientos según zona bioclimática, para reducir el consumo de electricidad en las edificaciones, en los aspectos de iluminación y refrigeración.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Resolución Nº 290 - Política de Respaldos de Información de la Agencia Ecuatoriana de Aseguramiento de la Calidad del Agro (AGROCALIDAD).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución implementa y ejecuta la Política de Respaldos de Información de la Agencia Ecuatoriana de Aseguramiento de la Calidad del Agro (AGROCALIDAD), cuyo objetivo es garantizar la continuidad de las operaciones de los sistemas de información y de la infraestructura informática, así como la información generada, procesada, y almacenada por estos sistemas, para minimizar el impacto por la pérdida total o parcial de datos y emplear los recursos informáticos de forma eficiente, mediante la implementación de Políticas y Procedimientos para la ejecución de respaldos de información considerada crítica para AGROCALIDAD. El proósito es contar con un Plan de Respaldos y Recuperación de la Información que permita asegurar la reanudación del proceso normal de la información y su disponibilidad, en caso de cualquier interrupción ya sea ocasionada por un desastre natural, falla tecnológica, error humano.

Policy: Resolution No. 450 of 2015 of Georgian Government on Main Radiation Safety Rules and Requirements for Handling Ionizing Radiation Sources
Policy_Content: The Resolution provides for safety rules when handling ionizing radiation sources. It consists of six chapters: General provisions (I); Main requirements for radiation safety (II); Planned radiation situation (III); Medical radiation (IV); Accidental radiation (V); and Existing radiation situation (VI). The Resolution provides for requirements imposed on the control and safety near ionizing sources of radiation; safety standards for the protection of workers, the public, patients and other persons under medical radiation; safety standards in radiation accidents; requirements imposed on open or unsupervised ionizing sources; permitted levels of radio-nuclide concentration in potable and mineral water, materials and soil, as well as in construction materials.

They implement Directive 2012/18/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control of major accident hazards involving dangerous substances, amending and subsequently repealing Council Directive 96/98/EC (“Seveso III Directive”), except for Articles 13 and 15, which relate to land use planning, and Article 30, which was implemented by the Control of Major Accident Hazards (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014. Policy: Law No. ZRU-393 “On sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be regulation of the relations in the sphere of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population. Sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall be considered the state of public health ensuring absence of negative environmental impact and favorable conditions for vital activity of the population. Main directions of state policy shall be as follows: (a) elaboration and implementation of sanitary, hygienic and epidemics control arrangements; (b) sanitary and epidemiological regulation; (c) improvement of sanitary awareness of the population; (d) state sanitary supervision; and (e) international cooperation.

Policy: Regulation on Creation, Reformation, Completion, Grading and Pricing Tourism Facilities and their Monitoring.
Policy_Content: The Regulation aims to regulates provisions on tourism facilities and responsibility of the Tourism Organization to monitor their activities. The Iran Cultural Heritage, Handicrafts and Tourism Organization is the only responsible entity to authorize the establishment, reformation and equipping of the tourism facilities. All tourism facilities will gain a temporary work permit and if they could meet the quality standards during this trial period the Organization will issue the operation license. The Organization would grade the tourism facilities based on technical specification, equipment, work force and quality of their services. The organization also provides these tourism facilities with approved cost rates for each grade. The Tourism Organization is obliged to monitor the quality and the price of services, sanitary conditions and other required standards of tourism facilities frequently. Any violation of the provisions of this Act would be punished by changes in the grade, suspension or revoke of the working licence.

Policy: Resolución Nº 4.28.2015: Reglamento de la Ley de Incentivos Forestales para Poseedores de Pequeñas Extensiones de Tierra de Vocación Forestal o Agroforestal – PINPEP.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución contiene el reglamento de la Ley de Incentivos Forestales para Poseedores de Pequeñas Extensiones de Tierra de Vocación Forestal o Agroforestal. Este reglamento rige los procedimientos y gestiones para la toma de decisiones de los actores involucrados. Los objetivos perseguidos incluyen: a) dar participación a los poseedores de pequeñas extensiones de tierras de vocación forestal o agroforestal que no cuenten con título de propiedad de las tierras que apliquen a los beneficios; b) incorporar la modalidad de establecimiento y mantenimiento de sistemas agroforestales a los titulares de proyectos  en el Programa de Incentivos Forestales; c) fomentar la equidad de género, priorizando la participación de grupos de mujeres en el manejo de bosques; d) generar empleo en el área rural; e) fomentar la biodiversidad forestal; f) propiciar el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de las comunidades, y satisfacer la necesidad de leña, vivienda y alimento; g) contribuir a la gestión socioambiental y territorial para la mitigación y adaptación a los efectos de la variabilidad y cambio climático, fortaleciendo la resiliencia de los ecosistemas forestales.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 750 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Novoorlovsky”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of regional significance “Novoorlovsky” shall be classified as complex (landscape) protected area. The scope of constituting state nature reserve of regional significance “Novoorlovsky” shall be conservation and reproduction of precious natural complexes, urban forests and maintaining ecological balance. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystem (massive forest); (b) conservation and reproduction of biological diversity and landscape; and (c) ecological education and educational tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) residential housing construction; (b) gardening, horticulture and smallholding; (c) environmental and soil pollution; (d) exploration of subsoil and mining, including soil disturbance; (e) burning of bonfires; (f) felling of forest species and timber extraction; (g) burning of vegetation; (h) waste disposal; and (i) passage and grazing of livestock.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Cabinet Resolution No.12 of 2015 regarding the regulation of the Palestinian National Center for Agricultural Research.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 12 articles aims at establishing and regulating the Palestinian National Center for Agricultural Research undertaking the following main tasks (i) preparing agricultural scientific research plans and programs of agricultural development, and achieve and implement the objectives of the agricultural policy, in addition to coordinating national agricultural research activities and transferring technology; (ii) using modern agricultural technology appropriate to local conditions and adopting it, whether in relation to plant production or animal and water production; (iii) transferring modern agricultural technologies, disseminating them to the extension agency and agricultural workers, and following up on the results of their application; (iv) holding training courses, conferences and workshops specialized in agricultural research; (v) cooperating with local, regional and international institutions to implement agricultural research programs; (vi) developing the skills of specialists, researchers and informants in agricultural research, and providing agricultural and environmental awareness agencies with approved technical information; and (viii) providing laboratory services regarding soil, water, feed, oils and toxicity tests, fertilizer analyzes, and others. An Advisory Council is formed, headed by the Minister of Agriculture and membership of representatives of the concerned Ministries, with the following powers (i) propose agricultural research strategies and plans and define their priorities within the general agricultural policy; (ii) propose annual financial allocations; (iii) propose draft agreements and contracts with all parties from outside the country; and (iv) propose foundations for cooperation with official authorities, universities, the private sector and scientific institutions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Decree No. 418 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persona and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Nairobi City County Regularisation of Developments Act, 2015 (No. 3 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to regularisation of unapproved developments in the Nairobi City County, including unauthorized development on public lands. The objectives of this Act are to- (a) bring unauthorized developments under the umbrella of planning framework and to provide basic facilities and infrastructure to the residents of the concerned areas in the County; (b) provide for regularisation of unauthorized developments commenced or completed before the date of commencement of this Act; (c) exclude unauthorized development made on any public land from the benefit of regularisation; (d) provide for regularisation of unauthorized developments made in conservation area declared as such under the relevant law; (e) provide for regularisation of unauthorized developments which fall within the required setoff specified in any law governing buildings; (f) provide for appointment of an advisory committee for the purpose of this Act. The provisions of the National Physical Planning Act relating to a matter of procedure or the manner of objections shall with the necessary modifications apply to the regularisation process under this Act. Policy: National Strategy and National Plan of 19 August 2015 for the management of contaminated sites in Romania.
Policy_Content: This National Strategy and National Plan of 19 August 2015 for the management of contaminated sites in Romania aims to provide an overview of the measures to be taken to investigate the pollution-affected land and surrounding areas and to decide whether it is a "contaminated site", as well as how corrective action will be regulated and validation of the remedied land to protect the receivers. In order to gain experience, the strategy starts from the internationally recognized risk-based approach that must be implemented as such. Over time, additional information and more experience will be accumulated and then translated into an adapted strategy. Thus, the strategy represents a major first step in the elaboration of the entire process of inventory, investigation and remediation of a large number of contaminated sites at national level, as well as for the inventory of sites potentially contaminated or that do not require corrective / remedial actions for their current or planned use. The purpose of this strategy is to set out the principles for the management of contaminated sites by 2015, defined as a short term, to solve the problem of contaminated sites requiring urgent action by 2020, defined as a medium term, and to complete the action by 2050. The general objective of the strategy is to protect human health and the environment from the effects of contaminants resulting from anthropogenic activities while respecting the principles of sustainable development. Specific environmental objectives are: a) reduction of the surface occupied by contaminated sites; b) improving the quality of environmental factors in the location areas and implementing a unitary management at national level. Specific socio-economic objectives are: a) the remediation of the contaminated sites must be done in such a way that an appropriate condition is reached for the planned subsequent use; b) ensuring the protection of water resources, food security and human health; c) promoting the future use of remedied sites for economic and social development to the detriment of removing productive lands from the agricultural and forestry circuit. Specific technical objectives are: a) developing, harmonizing and implementing the legislative framework for remedying contaminated sites and encouraging their reuse as a matter of priority; b) developing the institutional capacity for the management of contaminated sites; c) development of the services market in the field of investigation and remediation of contaminated sites; d) development and application of the best existing techniques, which do not generate excessive costs, for the investigation and remediation of contaminated sites; e) promoting and implementing the concept of acceptable risk. The methodology developed within the Strategy is based on the following principles: 1. the "polluter pays" principle; 2. compliance with European Union rules; 3. the principle of subsidiarity; 4. equal treatment; 5. distribution of tasks; 6. uniform judgment; 7. approach based on acceptable risk; 8. repeated reviews of decisions.

Policy: Law No. 267-V “On pastures and grazing”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds for sustainable management of pastures and regulates relations concerning rational management and protection of pastures, improvement of ecological, economic and resource potential thereof. Basic principles of the national legislation on pastures shall be as follows: (a) rational management and improvement of pastures; (b) protection of pastures and grazing grounds; (c) availability and accessibility of pastures for legal and natural persons; (d) subsidies and incentives for rational management and improvement of pastures; (e) control over management of pastures; (f) rate setting in the sphere of management and protection of pastures; (g) compensation for damages caused to pastures; and (h) liability for the infringement of the national legislation on pastures.

Policy: Law No. 266-V “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates apiculture, beekeeping, use of bees for pollination of entomophilous plants, obtaining apiculture products and protection of honey bees. It classifies apiaries and beehives as stationary and non-stationary. This Law shall have the following purposes: (a) meeting the demand of the population for apiculture products; (b) protection of legal rights and interests of legal and natural persons operating in the field of apiculture; (c) setting up conditions for promotion of apiculture practice; (d) protection of honey bees; (e) improvement of genetic resources of honey bees; and (e) improvement of honey processing technologies.

Policy: Geothermal Resources Development Act No. 13 of 2015.
Policy_Content: The main purposes of this Act are to (i) encourage and facilitate the safe production of geothermal energy for the benefit of the people of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines; (ii) encourage effective land management in the development and use of geothermal resources; and (iii) promote the use of renewable energy. This Act sets forth provisions on the establishment, organization, duties and responsibilities of the National Energy Committee, and moreover procedures of designation of geothermal resources areas, permit, license or concession to conduct geothermal resources activities, rights of holder of license and concession, compliance, enforcement and safety measures, registration of all related information, dispute settlement and financial provisions. The Committee may appoint sub-committee, working groups or advisory bodies to assist in the performance of its function or to further the objects of this Act. In case of a threat to human safety or the environment, the Committee may, after consultation with the Minister and in coordination with other appropriate governmental entities, undertake emergency response activities. This Act underlines that an application for a permit, license or concession may not be made for the lands in a forest reserve, terrestrial and marine national park and protected area, wildlife sanctuary or other similar area. The right of use and the rights of way shall only be granted to a person authorized to carry out geothermal resources activities under this Act in the relevant geothermal resources areas. The Minister responsible for energy may make regulations for the implementation of the provisions of this Act.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Electricity Act, 2015 (No. 18 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the generation and distribution of electric power and also makes provision for rural electrification and system planning in general. The objects of this Act include: (a) provide for a modern system of regulation of the generation, transmission, distribution, supply, despatch and use of electricity; (b) facilitate the achievement of the efficient, effective, sustainable and orderly development and operation of electricity supply infrastructure, supported by adequate levels of investment; (c) promote energy efficiency and the use of renewable and other energy sources. The planning process for transmission and distribution shall specifically consider the location of renewable and other generation sources, taking into account the potential for electrification of rural areas. The Minister may, by order, after consultation with the Office, prescribe renewable energy targets which may include a feed in tariff set by the Office for each source for renewable energy. There shall be established the System Benefit Fund, which shall be utilized to, among other things: (a) increase the penetration of renewable energy or energy security; (b) to promote of energy conservation; (c) to provide electricity to rural areas. The Act also establishes the Electricity Appeal Tribunal.

Policy: State Action Plan on Climate Change (Bihar SAPCC), 2015.
Policy_Content: The Bihar State Action Plan for Climate Change (Bihar SAPCC) has been formulated as a framework document with reference to the contours of the National Action Plan for Climate Change (NAPCC) formulated in 2008. It incorporates the tenets therein viz. Sustainable development, Co-benefits to society at large, Focus on adaptation, and mitigation and scientific research. It is also aligned with the focus areas/missions of NAPCC: Sustainable Agriculture, Water Resources, Forests & Biodiversity, Energy, Sustainable Habitat and Strategic Knowledge for Climate Change. Attempts have been made to incorporate the state specific traits, aspects and factors in profiling of the climate change scenarios, the vulnerability assessments and identifying the strategic and programmatic interventions and activities for adaptation and mitigation. In formulation of SAPCC, the UNDP consultants engaged by MoEF&CC, Govt. of India were associated after the first workshop held in 2011 and they initially steered and assisted in the preparation of the document from the first framework paper in 2012 till the final version was drafted after a consultative workshop in December 2014 and adopted by State Steering Committee in January 2015. The task has been accomplished over several rounds of interactions with and inputs from the designated nodal officers of the focus sector departments and reference to the SAPCC documents of some of the States endorsed by MoEF&CC, Govt. of India

Policy: Regional Decree No. 257-p “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Mines and Minerals Development Act, 2015 (No. 11 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to the extraction of material, whether solid, liquid or gaseous, from land or from beneath the surface of the earth in order to win minerals, or any operations directly or indirectly necessary or incidental to the extraction of the materials. Furthermore the Act concerns, among other things, trading in minerals, use of water, surface rights, environmental protection and administration. Policy: Regional Decree No. 243 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate. Annexes contain inspection order, compliance certificate, mapping and measurement schemes of land area.

Policy: Local Land Services Regulation 2014.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 104 Sections, divided into 13 Parts and completed by two Schedules aims at Local Land Services is to make and levy the following rates for each year: a) a general rate on all rateable land, b) an animal health rate. The rates may be made in the previous year but must be made by 31 March of the year to which they relate. Under clause 25, the Minister may extend the time within which the rates may be made. Local Land Services may make and levy one or more special purpose rates for any year on any land within a district if Local Land Services considers it is necessary to do so. A general rate, or a special purpose rate (if any), for rateable land is to consist of:  a) a base amount for each holding of rateable land (determined by Local Land Services), and b) an amount payable for each stock unit based on the total notional carrying capacity of rateable land in the district or for each constituent part of the district. An animal health rate for rateable land is to consist of: a) a base amount for each holding of rateable land (determined by Local Land Services), and b) an amount payable for each stock unit based on the total notional carrying capacity of rateable land in the district, or for each constituent part of the district, for which the annual returns lodged in the year preceding the year in which the rate is payable indicate that at least 50 stock units were kept on the land as at 30 June in the year.

Policy: Regional Governor’s Decree No. 716 validating the Regulation on state nature zoological reserve “Zaporozhsko-Tamansky” and boundaries thereof.
Policy_Content: State nature zoological reserve “Zaporozhsko-Tamansky” has a biological (zoological) profile and is intended for the preservation, restoration, reproduction of wild fauna species and habitats thereof, primarily rare and endangered wild fauna species, classified as game, inserted in the national and regional Red Books. The reserve is formed for an unlimited period of time and without expropriation of land plots from tenants, owners and managers of land plots. The objectives of the reserve are the conservation, restoration, reproduction of valuable wild fauna species, in particular rare and endangered wild fauna species classified as game. The following tasks are set for the reserve: (a) conservation of wild flora species and natural ecosystems, restoration of disturbed landscapes and biogeocenoses; (b) study and protection of wild fauna and wild flora species; (c) conservation of the objects of cultural heritage; and (d) creation of conditions for sustainable development of the natural potential of the region. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) all types of hunting except for regulation of the number of wild fauna species envisaged by the federal legislation; (b) stay with firearms, hunting gear and unleashed dogs; (c) collection of zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (d) aviation pest and disease control measures; (e) introduction of alien species; (f) burning grass, reed-cattail thickets and stubble in the fields; (g) drainage of waterbodies; (h) destruction and harvesting of reeds; (i) exploration and mining; (j) destruction or damage of barriers, notices, stands and other information signs; (k) use of waste water as fertilizer; (l) discharge of untreated waste water to waterbodies and soil; and (m) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste.

Policy: Community Based Health Care Strategy 2015-2020.
Policy_Content: The Community Based Health Care Strategy (CBHC) has been developed within the framework of the Ministry of Public Health (MoPH) national vision, mission and values. The vision of the Strategy is: working with communities on primary health care to benefit all Afghans close to their homes throughout the country. The mission of the community based health programme is to contribute to the reduction of morbidity and mortality rates, particularly among mothers and children. Through implementing evidence based health activities with the community and promoting a healthy lifestyle through community engagement and empowerment. While following all laws and regulations of the government of Afghanistan, the implementation of this strategy will respect the following guiding principles: Treating all people with dignity and respect, considering a healthy life to be a basic right of every individual. Ensuring equitable access to and provision of basic, essential, good quality health services for all individuals independent of gender, socio-economic status, age, race, religion and ethnicity. Ensuring optimum level of health for both men and women in full consideration of gender equality.

Policy: Décret n° 2015-1199 du 11 Août 2015 portant création du Centre National d’Application de Recherches Pharmaceutiques (CNARP).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée le Centre National d’Application de Recherches Pharmaceutiques (CNARP). Le CNARP a pour mission de : participer à l’élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de la politique nationale en matière de Recherches scientifique et technique; assurer dans le cadre de cette politique nationale, la définition, l’orientation, la promotion, L’innovation, la coordination et le contrôle de toutes les activités de recherches concernant les plantes médicinales (études ethnobotaniques et botaniques, chimiques, etc…), les produits d’origine animale et minérale ayant des propriétés thérapeutiques. Ses attributions sont : contribuer à l’étude et à l’amélioration de la culture de ces plantes et de l’exploitation de ces produits; contribuer à l’élaboration et la mise en application des mesures pour l’exploitation et la commercialisation industrielles desdites plantes et des produits d’origines autres que les plantes ainsi que des formes pharmaceutiques et médicamenteuses qui en dérivent; contribuer à la formation du personnel scientifique et technique en relation avec les départements ministériels concernés; contribuer au rassemblement, au traitement à la diffusion des informations scientifiques et techniques. Les organes du CNARP sont le Conseil d’Administration: organe délibérant; le Conseil Scientifique d’Orientation: organe d’instruction scientifique et technique; et la Direction : organe exécutif.

Policy: Trade, Industry and Cooperatives Sector Development Plan (2015/16 – 2019/20).
Policy_Content: This Trade, Industry and Cooperatives Sector Development Plan (TIC-SDP) is the second nationwide multi-sectoral document and it has been designed in the context of the Uganda Vision 2040 and the National Development Plan II and it broadly aims to significantly increase the contribution of the country’s Trade, Industry and Cooperative Sector to economic development, and reducing the widening trade deficit. The development envisaged by the Plan concerns the following areas (i) trade; (ii) industry; (iii) cooperatives; (iv) administration. In particular, the Trade, Industry and Cooperatives sector shall pursue the following strategic objectives in the five years between 2015 and 2020 (i) increase the share of manufactured goods and services in total exports; (ii) improve private sector competitiveness; (iii) increase market access for Uganda’s products and services in regional and international market; (iv) improve trade infrastructure; (v) promote the development of value added industries in agriculture and minerals; (vi) increase the productive capabilities for goods and services; (vii) promote the use of research, innovation and applied technology; (viii) promote green industry and climate smart industrial initiatives; (ix) promote the formation and growth of cooperatives and enhance their capacity to compete in domestic, regional and international markets; (x) increase the diversification of enterprises undertaken by cooperatives; (xi) enhance public administration and management; (xii) strengthen sector institutional infrastructure.

Policy: National Youth Policy (2015).
Policy_Content: This Policy is in continuation of earlier Policies from 1994 and 2006 which were developed to address the challenges facing youths. Policy: Nuclear Safety and Radiation Protection Act, 2015 (No. 17 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for the control of activities involving ionizing radiation and establishes the Hazardous Substances Regulatory Authority and the Hazardous Substances Appeal Tribunal. The objects of this Act are to- (a) protect people and the environment from exposure to ionizing radiation to the maximum extent that is reasonably practicable taking into account social and economic factors and recognizing the need for the use of ionizing radiation for beneficial purposes; (b) secure radioactive sources from misuse that may result in harm to people or the environment; (c) promote the radiation protection principles and an effective nuclear safety culture; (d) provide compensation for damage, loss and injuries caused by ionizing radiation; (e) allow for the beneficial and peaceful uses of nuclear technology; (t) achieve and maintain a high level of safety and security in facilities; (g) establish and maintain the Authority with sufficient independence and authority to effectively perform the functions set out in this Act; and (h) facilitate Jamaica's compliance with international obligations arising under the Conventions. A person shall not be in possession of an ionizing radiation source unless the person is granted an authorization to do so by the Authority. The Tribunal shall hear appeals from the decisions of the Authority.

Elle     soutient     également     les     efforts internationaux  dans  ce  domaine,  conformément  aux normes    internationales,    et    dans    le    cadre    des conventions  internationales,  régionales  et  bilatérales ratifiées par la République tunisienne. La loi est estructuré autour de IV Chapitres, à savoir: de la lutte contre le terrorisme et sa répression; de la lutte contre le blanchiment d’argent et sa répression; dispositions communes à la lutte contre le financement du terrorisme et au blanchiment d’argent; et dispositions finales et transitoires. Le document comprend des dispositions sur le régime pénale des infractions et institutionnel.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Sea, Water, General
Keyword: Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Public health,Hazardous substances,Environmental security,Food security,Fraud/deceit/adulteration,Continental shelf,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control

Policy: Decree No. 662 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on setting up and distribution of quotas for construction of renewable energy generating devices.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of setting up and distribution of quotas for construction of renewable energy generating devices for three-year calendar periods. These arrangements shall have as their purpose to ensure energy security of Belarus. The aforesaid quotas shall be distributed by ad hoc Commission. The Decree contains in attachment the application form.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 009-2015-MINAM ─ Medidas destinadas a la mejora de la calidad ambiental del aire a nivel nacional.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba medidas destinadas a la mejora de la calidad ambiental del aire a nivel nacional: a) queda prohibido el uso y la comercialización de Diésel B5 con un contenido de azufre mayor a 50 ppm; b) dispone la aplicación del Euro IV respecto a los Límites Máximos Permisibles de Emisiones Contaminantes para Vehículos Automotores que Circulen en la Red Vial; c) plazo para la implementación del Registro de Homologación Vehicular.

Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be performance of municipal land control by local government in the sphere of land relations. Policy: Regulation of Purchasing and Distribution of Saffron Bulb and Development of Saffron Cultivation
Policy_Content: The Regulation is based on the Seeds Law and sets provisions to manage purchase, distribution, and cultivation of saffron bulbs. The Regulation consists of 21 articles, divided into 5 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Responsibilities and Authorities (II); Committees of Saffron Bulb Purchase (III); Saffron Farmers (IV); Final Provisions (V). the main objectives of this Regulation include: to increase cultivation and production of saffron; to strengthen the economy of farmers through saffron cultivation; to encourage farmers to cultivate saffron and prevent the cultivation of illegal plants; to increase employment. Department of Agriculture Promotion and Development is the authority responsible to manage and monitor the process of preparation, purchase, and transfer of saffron bulb and to provide farmers with necessary equipments for its cultivation.

Policy: Regional Law No. 64-OZ “On objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the sphere of conservation, management, promotion and state protection of the objects of cultural heritage. State registration of the objects of cultural heritage shall include: (a) identification, inspection and listing of the objects of cultural heritage; (b) formation of the register of the identified objects of cultural heritage; (c) data collection related to the objects of cultural heritage; and (d) monitoring of the objects of cultural heritage.

Policy: Decree No. 16/2015 establishing the Regulation on the management and control of plastic bag.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 2 Chapters, establishes the Regulation on the management and control of plastic bag. This Regulation establishes procedures for the management and control of the plastic bag, with regard to its production, import, sale and use in order to reduce negative impacts on human health and the environment in general and applies to all public and private entities, natural and legal persons involved in the production, import, sale and use of plastic bags in the country. Offences and penalties are appended to the text. This Regulation applies to all public and private entities, natural and legal persons involved in the production, import, sale and use of plastic bag in the country. In addition, it specifies that the following provisions enter into force 180 days after publication of this Decree, relating to: a) import ban on plastic bags, whose proceedings are in progress; banning the production of the plastic bag with the characteristics described in paragraphs 1 and 2 of Article 4 and prohibition of resale.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Ley Nº 19.337 – Crea el Fondo para el Desarrollo (FONDES).
Policy_Content: Mediante esta Ley se crea el Fondo para el Desarrollo (FONDES), con la finalidad de dar apoyo y financiar proyectos productivos viables y sustentables. Entre los cometidos generales se contempla específicamente incrementar la productividad y su sustentabilidad, además de promover la responsabilidad social empresarial. A los efectos de recibir el apoyo del FONDES, los proyectos deben ser capaces de mejorar la calidad de vida y contribuir al equilibrio territorial, además de ser ambientalmente sustentables.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Public Private Partnerships Act, 2015.
Policy_Content: This Act concerns Public Private Partnership (PPP) and relative agreements between a contracting authority (Ministry, department of Government or any other body established by Government and mandated to carry out a public function) and a private party. This Act shall apply to all public private partnerships and in particular shall apply to the design, construction, maintenance and operation of infrastructure or services including water management facilities, including dams and water storages, water supply and distribution systems, irrigation and drainage systems and sanitation, sewerage and waste management systems and agricultural processing industries. The Act sets out principles to govern the implementation of PPP's, provides with respect to various procedures, and establishes the Public Private Partnerships Committee, the Public Private Partnerships Unit and a Project Development Facilitation Fund. The functions of the Committee include, among other things: (a) to ensure that each project agreement is consistent with the provisions of this Act; (b) to formulate policy on public private partnerships; (c) to ensure that all projects are consistent with the national priorities specified in the Public Private Partnerships Framework Policy.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy_Content: This Regional Government establishes plenary powers of the regional state bodies in the sphere of regulation of subsoil management related to concession of subsoil plots of local significance pertaining to the following categories: (a) subsoil plot containing common widespread minerals; (b) subsoil plots used for building and operation of underground constructions not related to mining; and (c) subsoil plot containing groundwater deposits used for potable water supply and public water supply, and also industrial water use supply or agricultural water use supply with daily amount of water abstraction no more than 500 cubic meters.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 558 validating Guidelines for management of radioactive substances and sources of ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree validates the Guidelines for environmental monitoring of areas located nearby storage facilities containing radioactive waste with a view of ensuring systematic environmental monitoring. The scope shall be safe management of radioactive waste. State regulation and supervision over safe management of radioactive substances and sources of ionizing radiation shall be applicable to: (a) enforcement of radiation safety; (b) compliance with rules and regulations applicable to radiation safety; (c) compliance with licensing terms and conditions applicable to radiation safety; and (d) elaboration and performance of the arrangements for protection of human life and health in case of outbreak of radiation accidents at facilities for management and storage of radioactive waste.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 559 validating the Regulation on management of domestic and non-domestic waste.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree regulates the issues related to management of domestic and non-domestic waste by legal and natural persons, establishes ecological requirements for waste disposal and waste disposal sites, and determines rates for waste formation setting limits for waste disposal. It shall not be applicable to radioactive, medical and biological waste. Owner of waste shall establish location of waste storage facilities, area and amount of waste subject to storage. Collection of recyclable waste shall be performed separately. Each waste storage facility and site shall be equipped with monitoring system of emissions to the atmospheric air.

Policy: Decreto Nº 237/15 - Establece la Iniciativa para la Productividad y la Competencia Nacional.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto establece la Iniciativa para la Productividad y la Competencia Nacional (IPCN), con el objetivo de identificar y promover acciones y reformas que impacten la productividad y la competitividad de los diversos sectores productivos del país, con la finalidad de avanzar hacia el desarrollo sostenible de la República Dominicana. Además, se crea un Consejo Consultivo, como instancia rectora de la Iniciativa para la Productividad y la Competitividad Nacional, el cual será responsable ante el Presidente de la República por el normal funcionamiento y logros de la mencionada iniciativa que estará integrado por: un Comité Ejecutivo del Consejo y un Comité Técnico de Apoyo. Las funciones del Comité Ejecutivo del Consejo Consultivo para la ejecución de la IPCN son: a) Propiciar los espacios para que las instituciones públicas, privadas y públicas, identifiquen las acciones pertinentes para incidir directa o indirectamente, en la productividad y la competitividad de los sectores productivos del país, tomando como referencia los índices de competitividad, facilidad de hacer negocios, riesgo país y objetivos de la END, así como cualquier otro indicador de relevancia para el tema. b) Recomendar acciones pertinentes y oportunas a las instituciones públicas y privadas que permitan encauzar sus planes y proyectos a los efectos de implementar las acciones y las reformas estructurales que impactan la productividad y competitividad del país.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regulation No. 100 date 5.8.2015 approving the rules of certification of the operator of natural gas transmission system.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down the rules of certification for operators of the natural gas transmission system with the purpose of ensuring a transparent, reliable, and coherent certification process that guarantees the independence of the natural gas transmission system. The Regulation is composed of the following Chapters: General Provisions (I); Certification requirements (II); Submission of Documents, Data, and Information (III); Certification Procedure (IV); and Final Provisions (V).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Ten Provisions on Fire and Explosion Protection in Oil and Gas Tank Areas.
Policy_Content: These Provisions were enacted according to the Work Safety Law and the Regulations on Safety Management of Hazardous Chemicals and related regulations, normative documents, and standards, aiming to cope with main problems exposed in recent years in major and typical accidents of oil tank area. The Provisions provide for the prohibited items in daily management, safety facilities, special operations, personnel qualification and other aspects of the oil tank areas. The over-temperature, overpressure and over-liquid-level operation of oil and gas storage tanks and the unauthorized change of storage media are forbidden (art.2). Operation workers are forbidden to leave work sites during the manual waterdraining, tank cut-over and loading and unloading in oil and gas tank areas (art.3).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Tanzania Extractive Industries (Transparency and Accountability) Act. 2015 (No. 23 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Tanzania Extractive Industries (Transparency and Accountability) Committee ("the Committee") and provides with respect to transparency and accountability in commercial operations concerning extraction of minerals, oil and natural gas. The Committee shall be an independent Government entity which shall be an oversight body for promoting and enhancing transparency and accountability in the extractive industry. The Act also establishes a Nominations Committee for purposes of appointment of Chairman and Executive Secretary the Committee. The Committee shall be responsible for ensuring that benefits of extractive industry are verified, duly accounted for and prudently utilized for the benefit of the citizens of Tanzania. It shall, among other things, develop a framework for transparency and accountability in the reporting and disclosure by all extractive industry company on revenues due to or paid to the Government and monitor activities of the extractive industry as prescribed.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Décret n°2015-948-PRESTRANS/PM/MICA du 04 août 2015 portant approbation des statuts de l’Agence pour la Promotion des Exportations du Burkina (APEX-Burkina).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret approuve les statuts de l’Agence pour la Promotion des Exportations du Burkina (APEX-Burkina). L’APEX-Burkina, en vue de mener à bien la mission qui lui est assignée par le Gouvernement, est notamment chargée : de collecter, traiter et diffuser à titre gratuit ou onéreux, l’information économique et commerciale par tous les moyens appropriés au profit des Professionnels du Commerce Extérieur et des Autorités; de collecter, analyser les données et publier les tendances d’évolution nationale et sectorielle des exportations des produits et services du Burkina Faso; de promouvoir les produits et services burkinabè sur les marchés national, régional et international à travers l’organisation et/ou la coordination de la participation des entreprises exportatrices du Burkina Faso aux manifestations commerciales nationales et internationales telles que les foires, les salons, les missions commerciales, etc.; de réaliser des études marketing spécifiques et des prospections de marchés; d’assurer la formation des professionnels et autres intervenants aux règles et pratiques du commerce international et des échanges intra¬ communautaires; d’apporter une assistance technique aux exportateurs dans la réalisation de leurs transactions commerciales; d’apporter une assistance technique à tout acteur économique dans le domaine des manifestations commerciales; d’assurer et/ou de faciliter le financement des entreprises exportatrices et des institutions ou organisations de promotions des exportations; de contribuer à l’évaluation de l’offre nationale des produits et services exportables; de contribuer à la veille et à l’intelligence économique du commerce extérieur du Burkina Faso; de participer aux commissions mixtes de coopération et aux négociations sur les traités et accords internationaux en matière de commerce.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: One Stop Border Posts Act, 2015 (No. 17 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment within the United Republic of one stop border posts. One Stop Border Post" means a border post established under an agreement between the United Republic and an adjoining State and includes control zones. The relevant legislation listed in the Schedule shall be applicable throughout One Stop Border Posts and shall be the basis for border control operations. Relevant legislation includes the Standards Act, the Export Control Act, the Agricultural Products (Control of Movement) Act, the Tanzania Food, drugs and Cosmetics Act, the Plant Protection Act and the Wildlife Conservation Act.

Policy: Resolución Nº 011-2015-VIVIENDA ─ Manual para la elaboración de Planes de Acondicionamiento Territorial (PAT).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Manual para la elaboración de Planes de Acondicionamiento Territorial (PAT), que es el instrumento técnico-normativo de planificación física integral en el ámbito provincial que orienta y regula la organización físico-espacial de las actividades humanas en cuanto a la distribución, jerarquía, roles y funciones de los centros poblados en los ámbitos urbano y rural; la conservación y protección del recurso y patrimonio natural y cultural; el desarrollo de la inversión pública y privada en los ámbitos urbano y rural del territorio provincial; y, la ocupación y uso planificado del territorio, para lograr el mejoramiento de los niveles y calidad de vida de la población urbana y rural, bajo el enfoque territorial prospectivo, competitivo y de sostenibilidad.

Policy: Resolución Nº 189-2015-MINAM ─ Lineamientos para el Manejo Integrado de las Zonas Marino Costeras.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para el Manejo Integrado de las Zonas Marino Costeras, para la realización del Objetivo 16 de la la Agenda Nacional de Acción Ambiental, que se propone la gestión integral de los territorios regionales de la costa para que cuenten con instrumentos para el Manejo Integrado de las Zonas Marino-Costeras (MIZMC). Su objetivo general es fortalecer la gestión ambiental de las zonas marino costeras, a través de la implementación de un proceso de planificación que permita el crecimiento económico y desarrollo sostenible de las zonas marino costeras y su entorno; aprovechando de manera sostenible los recursos naturales y los servicios ecosistémicos que estos ámbitos brindan.

Policy: National Biodiversity Programme.
Policy_Content: National Biodiversity Programme is a national sectoral programme of Mongolia covering the period of 2015-2025. Its four main strategies include: increasing awareness and knowledge on Biodiversity conservation and sustainable use among both decision makers and the general public; developing and implementing science based policy on conservation and sustainable use of biological resources; sustainable use of biodiversity; and improving policies and legal environment for conservation and use of biological diversity and ecological services.

Policy: Republic of Macedonia Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC).
Policy_Content: The Republic of Macedonia, in agreement with the Decision No. 42-17/91 of the 91st Session of the Government held on 28 July 2015, intends to give the following contribution to the global efforts for green house gas emissions reduction (Macedonian INDC): to reduce the CO2 emissions from fossil fuels combustion for 30%, that is, for 36% at a higher level of ambition, by 2030 compared to the business as usual (also called the BAU) scenario. Policy: Genetic Technology - Cultivation Ban Framework Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act - within the meaning of the precautionary principle - is the coordination between the agricultural and environmental policy in order to avoid adverse effects of genetically modified organisms and to conserve the natural foundations of life, biodiversity, peasant agriculture and forestry taking into account the ecological compatibility, regional balances and considering also mountain areas and other disadvantaged areas. An Advisory Board consisting of both representatives of the federal state and the Länder shall be established within the Federal Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry, the Environment and Water Resources. The Advisory Board has the following tasks: 1) mutual exchange of information on European and regional developments in the approval, monitoring and use of genetically modified organisms for cultivation; 2) coordinating position in the cultivation, restriction or prohibition of genetically modified organisms in accordance with article  26 b, paragraphs 3 and 4 of Directive 2001/18/EG on the deliberate release of genetically modified organisms into the environment of 17 April 2001; 3) coordinating coexistence of measures to maintain GMO-free farming and production chain; 4) reciprocal exchange of information on social, economic and environmental impact in the regions and rural areas in terms of traditional, regional or sustainable farming practices.

Policy: National Land Policy of Sierra Leone.
Policy_Content: The Final National Land Policy (NLP) of Sierra Leone provides the vision, principles and policy components to give direction to and definition of the roles and responsibilities of various government and customary authorities, and other non-state actors, in land management. Specifically, it enunciates policy statements in respect of the key components of the National Land Policy such as access to land and tenure, land use, regulation and the management of special land issues, land administration structures, land laws and the Constitution. The document addresses the major issues related to land management and administration in Sierra Leone, with a view to moving towards a clearer, more effective and just land tenure system that shall provide for social and public demands, stimulate responsible investment and form a basis for the nation’s continued development. The text of the policy is composed of the following Chapters: 1) Introduction; 2) Vision and guiding principles; 3) The land question; 4) Issues related to constitutional reform; 5) Land tenure framework; 6) Facilitating equitable access to land; 7) Land rights administration and institutional framework; 8) Land use planning and regulation for land development; 9) Land issues requiring special intervention; 10) Land policy implementation framework.

Policy: Programme d’Investissement pour la Forêt (PIF) - Project d'Appui aux Communautés dépendantes de la Forêt en République Démocratique du Congo.
Policy_Content: Le Programme d’Investissement pour la Forêt (PIF) est l’un des trois programmes du Fonds Stratégique pour le Climat (FSC), qui est un fonds fiduciaire multi-donateurs créé en 2009, dans le cadre d’un partenariat dénommé Fonds d’Investissement Climatique (FIC) en vue de fournir un financement accéléré pour réduire la déforestation et la dégradation des forêts dans les pays tropicaux. Et, Le Mécanisme Spécial de Don (DGM) pour les Peuples Autochtones et les Communautés Locales (PA-COLO) a été créé et développé comme un programme spécial dans le cadre du PIF. Le DGM conçu dans le cadre du PIF vise à fournir des subventions aux PA-COLO en vue de soutenir leur participation au développement des stratégies, programmes et projets d’investissement du PIF, ainsi qu’à d’autres processus REDD+ aux niveaux local et national. Le DGM est mis en oeuvre à travers le Projet d’Appui aux Populations Dépendantes de la Forêt (PACDF). L’objectif de long terme du PACDF dans le cadre du PIF est de contribuer aux efforts du pays en matière: (i) de développement, en vue de réduire les émissions provenant de la déforestation et de  la  dégradation  des  forêts,  et  de  promouvoir  la  gestion  durable  des  forêts;  et  (ii)  du renforcement des stocks de carbone forestier (REDD+). Sur le long terme, le projet contribuera à: améliorer la gestion des ressources naturelles en appuyant les PA-COLO dans leurs efforts de développement; appuyer le processus de décentralisation en RDC en soutenant l'émergence de nouveaux leaders ruraux et le renforcement de leur voix en ce qui concerne les politiques de gestion de l'utilisation des terres; garantir les droits d'utilisation des terres de la population rurale pauvre en améliorant leur inclusion dans les politiques de gestion de l'utilisation des terres; et offrir des perspectives de développement alternatif qui aurait un impact réduit sur la forêt et qui sera culturellement adapté aux habitants de la forêt.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Sector Vivienda, Ciudad y Territorio, en lo relacionado con la cobertura de tasa de interés para los potenciales deudores de crédito pertenecientes a los hogares que resulten beneficiarios del Programa de Promoción de Acceso a la Vivienda de Interés Social “Mi Casa Ya”, a través del Fondo de Reserva para la Estabilización de la Cartera Hipotecaria (FRECH), para faciliter la financiación de vivienda de interés social nueva urbana a los potenciales deudores de crédito pertenecientes a los hogares que resulten beneficiarios del subsidio familiar de vivienda en el marco del mencionado Programa. Policy: Strategic Framework on Climate Policy.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 2051 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 97/A - Norma de calidad ambiental del recurso suelo y criterios de remediación para suelos contaminados (Anexo 2, Libro VI de la Calidad Ambiental, del Texto Unificado de la Legislación Secundaria del Ministerio del Ambiente).
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide el Anexo 2 del Texto Unificado de Legislación Secundaria del Ministerio del Ambiente referente a la Norma de calidad ambiental del recurso suelo y criterios de remediación para suelos contaminados. Corresponde a las autoridades municipales con una población mayor o igual a 250 000 habitantes elaborar mapas de ruido ambiental como una herramienta estratégica para la gestión del control de la contaminación acústica y la planificación territorial.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 541validating the Regulation on constitution, modification of category, validation of boundaries and cancellation of protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree regulates the issues of constitution, modification of category, validation of boundaries and cancellation of protected areas. Protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) state nature reserves; (b) state natural parks; (c) state nature monuments; (d) state nature reserves; (e) state botanical gardens, dendrological and zoological parks; (f) biosphere reserves; and (g) transboundary protected areas. Protected areas shall be constituted with the consideration of ecological, scientific and economic substantiation, and also historical and cultural value. Initiators of constitution of a protected area can be: (a) authorized state body in the sphere of environmental protection; (b) ministries and departments; (c) National academy of sciences; (d) local government; (e) citizens of Kyrgyz Republic; and (f) non-governmental ecological organizations and associations.

Policy: Regional Law No. 104 “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the allotment, free of charge, of public land plots with delimited ownership and pertaining to the regional or municipal public land stock in ownership to some categories of citizens. The following categories of citizens shall have the right of allotment free of charge of public land in ownership: (a) multi-child families with three or more children; (b) single-parent families with dependent children of minority age with three or more children; and (c) single-parent family with three or more children of minority age, including adopted children. Plots of land shall be granted within the boundaries of municipal district of permanent residence. Plots of land can be allotted once-only for the following purposes: (a) individual housing construction either in rural areas or in non-rural areas; and (b) subsidiary small-holding and family farming out of stock of available agricultural land.

Policy: Caribbean Community Climate Change Centre Act, 2015 (No. 6 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for approval of the acceptance by Belize of the Agreement Establishing the Caribbean Community Climate Change Centre and the Protocol on the Provisional Application of the Agreement. The Agreement and the Protocol shall have the force of law in Belize. The Minister may, by Order published in the Gazette, make provisions as may be necessary or expedient for giving effect to any Article of the Agreement. Belize shall host the Centre. The objectives of the Centre shall be: (a) protection of the climate system of Members of the Centre for the benefit of present and future generations of their peoples; (b) enhancing regional institutional capabilities for the coordination of national responses to the negative effects of climate change; (c) providing comprehensive policy and technical support in the area of climate change and related issues and spearheading regional initiatives in those areas; and (d) performing the role of executing agency for regional environmental projects relating to climate change.

Policy: Decree on the landfill of waste and temporary storage of metallic mercury.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment, which is composed of 14 articles and six Annexes, lays down requirements for the landfill of waste and temporary storage of metallic mercury. When selecting a site for the landfill of waste or temporary storage of metallic mercury the following criteria must be taken into account: (1) the safe distance of the landfill from residential areas or recreational areas, watercourses, water reservoirs and water resources; (2) geological, hydrological, hydrogeological and engineering-geological conditions of the area; (3) the protection of nature and the countryside and the protection of cultural heritage of the area; (4) possible extreme meteorological impacts and their consequences; (5) final opinion of the environmental impact assessment. Building and technical requirements for the construction of the landfill of waste are specified in art. 3. Art. 4 provides requirements for sewage disposal.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 4-1/699 validating the Regulation on formation and keeping state electronic register of holders of grain receipts.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the procedure for maintaining the state electronic register of holders of grain receipts, the procedure for issuing, circulation and redemption of grain receipts, as well as providing access to the state electronic register of holders of grain receipts. Grain receipt is a warehouse certificate in the form of a non-documentary non-issue security, confirming the ownership of a certain amount of grain. The following types of transactions are recorded in the register of grain receipts: (a) global operations; (b) operations on the personal account; (c) operations with grain receipts; and (d) information operations. Grain receipts transactions include: (a) issue of grain receipts; (b) redemption of grain receipts; (c) division of the grain receipt; (d) consolidation of grain receipts; (e) sale/purchase of grain receipts; (f) enrollment/write-off of a grain receipt; (g) transfer/receipt of a grain receipt as a pledge; (h) change of information on the pledge of the grain receipt; (i) return/receipt from the pledge of the grain receipt; (j) publication of the notice of trading on the grain receipt; (k) change of grain receipt data; (l) change of grain characteristics in the grain receipt; and (m) blocking/unblocking the grain receipt.

Policy: Resolution No. 69/2015 approving the National Strategy on Food and Nutrition Security – 2020 (ENSAN- 2020).
Policy_Content: This National Strategy for Food and Nutrition Security - 2020 (ENSAN- 2020) has a twin-track approach for immediate hunger relief interventions with a long-term strategy for sustainable growth of the population and as its main goal to ensure permanent and stable access of the population to adequate, healthy, nutritious and safe food, subject to the satisfaction of other basic needs, enabling to realize their human right, in terms of access to food, food availability and food utilisation to adequate food. It addresses agro-environmental concerns and agro-environmental measures are included in the objectives and/or intended actions. As the strategic objectives ENSAN - 2020 aims at strengthening the legislative and institutional framework to consolidate the Food and Nutrition Security (SAN) and to ensuring the respect of Human Rights to Adequate Food (DHAA). Another goal should be to increase the participation of women in the policy making, given their important role in agricultural production systems.

Policy: Ley Nº 137 - Para añadir un nuevo Artículo 7-A al Plan de Reorganización Nº 4 de 2010, Plan de Reorganización del Departamento de Agricultura de 2010.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley define las facultades, funciones y deberes del Departamento de Agricultura en cuanto a la seguridad alimentaria, que incluyen: (a) fomentar la producción sostenible, rentable y sustentable de alimentos; (b)        establecer incentivos para la utilización productiva de la tierra, minimizando la falta de aprovechamiento o acaparamiento de tierras productivas y otros mecanismos de redistribución de la tierra; (c) impulsar la asociación de los microempresarios, microempresas y pequeños y medianos productores, con relación al proceso de producción, almacenamiento, transformación, conservación y comercialización de alimentos; (d) incentivar el consumo de alimentos sanos y nutritivos, producidos localmente mediante una diversidad de prácticas agrícolas, incluyendo los métodos tradicionales y de alta productividad, así como aquellos de origen agroecológico y orgánico; (e)        promover las políticas fiscales, tributarias, arancelarias y otras que protejan al sector agroalimentario local, para evitar la dependencia en la provisión alimentaria externa; y (f) promover la participación social y la deliberación pública en forma paritaria entre hombres y mujeres, en la elaboración de leyes y en la formulación e implementación de políticas relativas a la seguridad alimentaria.

Policy: Community Empowerment (Scotland) Act 2015 (2015 Asp 6).
Policy_Content: This Act provides a legal framework that will promote and encourage community empowerment and participation. It creates new rights for community bodies and places new duties on public authorities. The Act amends the Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2003, extending the community right to buy to all of Scotland, urban and rural, and improving procedures. It also introduces a new  provision for community bodies to purchase land which is abandoned, neglected or causing harm to the environmental wellbeing of the community, where the owner is not willing to sell that land.  The purchase must be in the public interest and compatible with the achievement of sustainable development of the land. The Act also allows for different types of community bodies to be involved in forestry leasing. “Land” for this purpose includes inland waters (within the meaning of section 69(1) of the Salmon and Freshwater Fisheries (Consolidation) (Scotland) Act 2003).

Policy: Kenya’s Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC), 23 July 2015.
Policy_Content: Kenya aims to achieve a low carbon, climate resilient development pathway. Kenya will continue to implement the NCCAP (2013-2017), and subsequent action plans beyond this period to achieve this target. This will include the promotion and implementation of the following mitigation activities: Expansion in geothermal, solar and wind energy production, other renewables and clean energy options; Enhancement of Energy and resource efficiency across the different sectors; Make progress towards achieving a tree cover of at least 10% of the land area of Kenya; Clean energy technologies to reduce overreliance on wood fuels; Low carbon and efficient transportation systems; Climate smart agriculture (CSA) in line with the National CSA Framework; Sustainable waste management systems.

Policy: Resolution No. 371 of 2015 of Georgian Government on Charter for Undertaking State Supervision of Fire and Public Safety
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the charter for undertaking state supervision of fire and public safety. It consists of 19 chapters: General provisions (I); List of official of the supervisory agencies, their rights and obligations in the areas of state fire safety control, and supervision of public safety objects (II); Main directions and authority for organizing state fire safety control, and supervision of public safety objects (III); Planning the assessments and accounting the objects of state fire safety control, and supervision of public safety (IV); Organizing state fire safety control, goals, objectives and implementation of such control (V); Organizing the control of prevention of and response to emergencies, goals, objectives and implementation of such control (VI); Lists of the objects of state fire safety control, and supervision of public safety, and the periodic assessment thereof (VII); Rights and obligations of the control object (VIII); Fire-technical checks and research (IX); Formalizing the results of control measures, liability for violating the requirements imposed on fire safety, and prevention of and response to emergencies (X); Normative-technical work (XI); Organizing the methods to determine (to confirm) compliance of objects and/or construction documents with fire safety rules, technical regulation and/or standards (XII); Administrative infraction proceedings (XIII); Fully suspending and partially suspending use or certain operations of an object of state fire safety control, buildings, industrial area, equipment and/or storage (XIV); Study and investigation of fire causes (XV); Official statistical accounting of fires and their results and state statistical accounting (XVI); Informational support in the area of fire safety, anti-fire campaigns, and organizing the education of the public on fire safety (XVII); Ensuring the organization and implementation of fire safety and public safety control in the supervisory state agencies (XVIII); and Accounting and analysis of the work undertaken at the supervisory agencies (XIX).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Resolución Ministerial nº259 de 23 de julio 2015 - Reglamento específico para la contratación directa de bienes, obras y/o servicios generales del Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y Agua, en el marco del Decreto Supremo nº2294
Policy_Content: El objetivo del presente reglamento es implantar en el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y Agua, la normativa interna específica y los  procedimientos  necesarios para  la contratación directa de  bienes,  obras y/o servicios  generales, identificando  a  las  unidades  y  cargos  de  los  servidores  públicos responsables de su aplicación, en el marco de lo establecido en el Decreto Supremo N° 2294 de 18 de marzo de 2015. Podrán participar en las contrataciones realizadas por el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y  Agua en  el  marco  del  presente  Reglamento,  aquellos  proveedores  que  realicen  las siguientes actividades: la  producción  que  hacen  directamente  los  agricultores,  ganaderos,  avicultores  y otros similares de los frutos y productos de sus cosechas, ganados, aves, y otros, a menos que tal producción y negociación constituya por si misma, una actividad empresarial; los  trabajos  u  oficios  manuales  o  de  servicio  de  los  artesanos,  obreros  y  otros, establecidos  sin  condición  de  empresarios y  cuya  subsistencia  depende  del producto de aquellos; las pensiones familiares atendidas personalmente por su propietario, cuando este realice esa actividad como un medio de subsistencia; y la adquisición de frutos, mercaderías y otros bienes con destino al consumo o uso del adquiriente o el ofrecimiento ocasional de cualquier excedente.

Policy: Order No. 140 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the Regulation on the requirements for nuclear and radiation safety in the information and control systems of importance to safety of nuclear power plants.
Policy_Content: These Requirements apply to information and control systems important for the safety of nuclear power plants, and their components: (a) software and hardware complexes that are part of the information and control systems, including the operational autonomous components of these software and hardware complexes; (b) operational autonomous technical means of automation, which are part of the information and control systems; and (c) software of information and control systems, software and hardware complexes and in the presence of technical means of automation. The scope of the Requirements shall be prevention of nuclear accidents and disasters at nuclear power plants. Each nuclear power plant shall be equipped with information system for monitoring the radiation situation in the premises and in the nuclear power plant, in the sanitary protection zone and surveillance zone. Radiation control functions are performed in all modes of operation of the power unit, in case of violations of normal operation, in emergencies, during accidents envisaged and not envisaged by design, in post-accident modes, and also when the unit is put out of operation.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 1420/82031 Code of Good Agricultural Practice for the Protection of Waters from Nitrates of Agricultural Origin.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision, consisting of 10 articles completed by eight Annexes, establishes the Code of Good Agricultural Practice for the Protection of Waters from Nitrates of Agricultural Origin. The Code is intended to provide a guidance for the application of good agricultural practices for agricultural and livestock activities in order to protect the environment while at the same time safeguarding their income. In particular, the Code is aimed at avoiding pollution of ground and surface waters by nitrates, which are derived from the following activities: fertilizers with nitrogen compounds or treated livestock waste or pasture where they graze animals and deposit manure. This Code applies throughout the country. However, for those engaged in agricultural and livestock activities whose holdings are located in the vulnerable zones, additional provisions set out in the Action Plans apply. This code includes: a) Definitions (Article 3); b) Good Agricultural Practices for the application of nitrogenous fertilizers (Article 4; c) Good Agricultural Practices for the storage and transport o nitrogen fertilizers (Article 5); d) Good Agricultural Practices for the management of animal waste in livestock farms (Article 6); e) Good Agricultural Practice for the application of animal husbandry waste to the soils (Article 7); f) agricultural practices for irrigation (Article 8).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Farming,Soil pollution/quality,Fertilizers/nutrients,Irrigation,Water quality standards,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
