Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 24 articles aims at establishing the Palestinian Agricultural Lending Institution dependent on the Cabinet. Tasks of this institution are: granting loans to farmers and companies operating in the agricultural sector; encouraging the farmers to establish agricultural projects and projects for agricultural products processing also contributing to the corporates capital for a maximum of 15%; preparing studies on the economic and technical feasibility of the projects and their evaluation; and investing in the development of the agricultural sector and related activities. Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 009-2015-MINAGRI ─ Estrategia Nacional de Agricultura Familiar 2015 - 2021.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Nacional de Agricultura Familiar es un instrumento sectorial de alcance nacional que tiene por objetivo promover el rol de la agricultura familiar, por su aporte al desarrollo sostenible y la inclusión social, con el fin último de mejorar la calidad de vida de los agricultores y agricultoras familiares, enfatizando sus propias iniciativas, experiencias y potencialidades. Policy: Regulation No. 716 on alien organisms.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to prevent the import, stocking and spread of alien organisms that have, or may have, adverse effects on biodiversity. It applies to the Norwegian land territory (including waterways) in the Norwegian territorial waters and on Jan Mayen. Organisms which may be imported, provided permit, include these listed in Appendix II - provided that the conditions set out in the Appendix are complied with. Plants. Freshwater organisms living at temperatures above 5 degrees C (for ornamental purposes). Marine plants, invertebrates and fish exclusively held in closed containers on land. Micro-organisms. Biological pesticides which have been granted import permission. And mushrooms and algae for human consumption.

Policy: Loi modifiant la loi modifiée du 1er août 2007 relative à l’organisation du marché du gaz naturel.
Policy_Content: La présente loi apporte des modifications à la loi du 1er août 2007 relative à l’organisation du marché du gaz naturel. Notamment, l’article 38 de la loi précitée du 1er août 2007 est complété par un nouveau paragraphe libellé comme suit: «(4) Sur demande d’une commune, le gestionnaire de réseau de distribution concerné communique sous forme agrégée et sans préjudice de la confidentialité les données de consommation pertinentes relatives aux points de fourniture des clients situés sur le territoire de cette commune. Dans ce cas, le gestionnaire de réseau peut demander le remboursement des frais réels occasionnés pour le traitement de cette demande». En outre, un nouvel article 12bis est inséré dans la loi précitée établissant que les fournisseurs, ainsi que les fournisseurs visés par la loi modifiée du 1er août 2007 relative à l’organisation du marché de l’électricité, desservant des clients finals sis au Grand-Duché de Luxembourg sont soumis à une obligation d’économies d’énergie. Policy: Act Preventing the Environmental Pollution of Mercury (No. 42).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 35 articles divided into ten Chapters, in combination with the Waste Management and Public Cleaning Act (Act No. 137 of 1970) and other acts providing for the control of mercury and mercury compounds, aims to control the emissions of mercury and mercury compounds into the environment, to protect human health and to maintain the integrity of the living environment, by taking measures to regulate primary mercury mining, the manufacture and distribution in commerce of mercury-using products, the use of mercury or mercury compounds in specified manufacturing processes, the extraction of gold using mercury and mercury compounds, the storage of specified mercury and mercury compounds, and the management of mercury-containing recyclable resources, and by taking other measures needed to ensure the reliable and smooth implementation of the Minamata Convention on Mercury, cooperating on an international level in order to prevent mercury from polluting the environment.

Policy: Regional Law No. 201-ZO “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) increase of industrial production output; (d) promotion of innovations and research in industry; (e) application of best available industrial technologies and methods; and (f) ensuring technological independence of the regional economy. Particular attention shall be paid to promotion of inter-regional and international cooperation in various branches of industry.

Policy: Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2015 (W.S.I. No. 1394 (W. 138) of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (Wales) Regulations 2009 in regulations 8, 10 and 11 to implement the changes to the Environmental Liability Directive introduced by Article 38 of Directive 2013/30/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on safety of offshore oil and gas operations and amending Directive 2004/35/EC(3). Article 38 of Directive 2013/30/EU extends the definition of ‘environmental damage’ contained in the Environmental Liability Directive to include damage that significantly adversely affects the environmental status of marine waters as defined in Directive 2008/56/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for community action in the field of marine environmental policy.

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Air Pollution from Ships) Regulations 2015 (B.R. No. 45 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by section 122 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, provide for the control of air pollution emissions from: (a) Bermuda ships; (b) other ships while they are within Bermuda waters. In part they also apply to platforms. The Regulations require an appropriate certificate (a Bermuda Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate in the sense of the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships 1973) to be issued for ships to which these Regulations apply and concern issue of certificates by Bermudan authorities and issue of certificates by foreign authorities. They also provide for standards and rules for the emissions (Nitrogen oxides, Sulphur oxides, volatile organic compounds), shipboard incineration and the use of fuels. The deliberate emission of an ozone-depleting substance from a ship is prohibited.

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Pollution by Sewage and Garbage from Ships) Regulations 2015 (BR 44/2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by section 122 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, provide for the control disposal of garbage and discharge of sewage from marine ships. A “discharge” does not include dumping within the meaning of the Convention on the Prevention of Marine Pollution by Dumping of Wastes and Other Matter. Regulation 6 sets out to which ships specific provisions of these Regulations apply. They also apply in part to platforms and apply restrictions on Bermuda ships entering the Antarctic area. The Regulations implement the  International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships 1973 (including its protocols, annexes and appendices thereto) as amended by the Protocols of 1978 and 1997. The Convention includes— all the amendments to that Convention adopted by the Marine Environment Protection Committee of the IMO before the date on which these Regulations are made; and any subsequent amendment to that Convention which is considered by the Minister to be relevant from time to time. Implementation concerns, among other things, certification of ships, garbage management plns, record keeping and restrictions applying to Special Areas.

Policy: Ley Nº 4/2015 - Ley de mejora de la estructura territorial agraria de Galicia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer los mecanismos y recursos para la mejora de la estructura territorial de las explotaciones agrarias de Galicia, con el fin de: a) mejorar las condiciones estructurales, técnicas y económicas de las explotaciones agrarias en Galicia, de acuerdo con criterios de ordenación adecuada y sostenible de las mismas y de sus cultivos y aprovechamientos, cualesquiera que sean estos, bajo la perspectiva de su utilidad económica y social, con el fin de fijar la población en el medio rural en orden a hacer rentable la actividad productiva; b) establecer, para las fincas que no formen parte de explotaciones agrarias, medidas de agrupación, redimensionamiento, mejora estructural y de infraestructuras que faciliten su movilización para uso agrario, entendiendo por tal la lucha contra el abandono, la formación de nuevas explotaciones o la incorporación a las ya existentes, prestando especial atención al apoyo a la constitución de iniciativas asociativas para el aprovechamiento en común; c) ordenar adecuadamente la estructura territorial agraria y mitigar los efectos perjudiciales sobre la estructura de las explotaciones por causa de la ejecución de grandes obras públicas o de explotación de cotos mineros; d) facilitar la adecuación territorial de áreas con elevados valores medioambientales o paisajísticos, o bien con la presencia de algún elevado riesgo ambiental, de tal manera que se potencie la conservación y permanencia de dichos valores o se reduzca la potencial incidencia del riesgo, a través de la reorganización espacial y funcional de la estructura territorial existente; e) mitigar los efectos del cambio climático mediante el establecimiento de medidas adecuadas y contribuir con actuaciones de adaptación a sus efectos; f) incrementar la sostenibilidad, competitividad y desarrollo integral del territorio rural mediante actuaciones intensivas; g) incrementar la superficie de las explotaciones mediante la movilización de fincas de vocación agraria incluidas en perímetros en estado de abandono; y h) apoyar las explotaciones agrarias mediante la reducción de la tributación por la adquisición de explotaciones agrarias y elementos afectos y de fincas rústicas.

Policy: Decision No. 872/2015/QD-TTg approving the adjusted master plan on socio-economic development of Thanh Hoa province through 2020, with orientations toward 2030.
Policy_Content: This Decision approves the adjusted master plan on socio-economic development of Thanh Hoa province through 2020, with orientations toward 2030, with the following principal contents: 1. The master plan on socio-economic development of Thanh Hoa province through 2020, with orientations toward 2030, must be in line with the country’s socio-economic development strategy and the master plans on socio-economic development of the northern central and central coastal regions; and harmonized with the country’s sectoral master plans. 2. To ensure fast and sustainable socio-economic development based on economic restructuring associated with changing the growth model in the direction of intensive and extensive combination; to accelerate intensive growth rate, lay a premise for in-depth development after 2020 so as to raise the quality, efficiency and competitiveness of the economy, ensure the harmony with the national strategy on green growth and sustainable development. 3. To focus all investment sources on developing key economic sectors and motive-force economic regions to create breakthroughs in growth and economic restructuring and make re-investment to create harmonious development and narrow development gaps among different areas in the province. 4. To attach importance to development of human resources, especially high-quality human resources, and promote the application of scientific-technological advances, considering it a motive force to raise provincial competitiveness.

Policy: Décret n° 2015-686 du 17 juin 2015 relatif au plan régional de l'agriculture durable.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret modifie les dispositions relatives au plan régional de l'agriculture durable. En effet, la loi d'avenir pour l'agriculture, l'alimentation et la forêt a renforcé les plans régionaux de l'agriculture durable (PRAD) en instaurant un pilotage conjoint de leur élaboration par le préfet de région et le président du conseil régional et en plaçant l'agroécologie au cœur des orientations de la production agricole. Le PRAD, qui fixe les orientations de la politique agricole et agroalimentaire de l'Etat sur le territoire régional, voit son contenu élargi aux orientations et actions de la région en matière agricole, agroalimentaire et agro-industrielle. Le décret modifie, en conséquence, la partie réglementaire du code rural et de la pêche maritime relative au PRAD afin de tenir compte de ces nouvelles orientations.

Policy: National Strategy on Adaptation to Climate Change.
Policy_Content: The National Strategy on Adaptation to Climate Change is a cross-sectoral strategic document adopted by the Ministry of the Environment to respond to the broader goals set out in the adaptation strategy package approved by the European Commission in 2013, with the aim of making Europe better prepared to withstand existing and future climate impacts. This national strategy aims in particular at: (a) reducing risks that arise from climate change; (b) protecting public health; (c) preserving natural heritage; (d) maintaining and strengthening the resilience and adaptation capacity of natural, economic and social systems; (e) taking advantage of potential benefits that new climatic conditions may create.

Policy: Ley Nº 20.848 - Establece marco para la inversión extranjera directa en Chile y crea la institucionalidad respectiva.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco legal para la inversión extranjera directa en Chile y crea la institucionalidad respectiva. Su ámbito de aplicación abarca los inversionistas extranjeros que efectúen inversiones conforme a las definiciones y requisitos de la presente Ley. Se establecen los derechos básicos de los inversionistas extranjeros, incluyendo el derecho a no ser discriminados, a remesar al exterior el capital transferido y las utilidades líquidas que sus inversiones generen, etc. Asimismo, se contempla la elaboración de una Estrategia de Fomento y Promoción de la Inversión Extranjera, por parte del Presidente de la República, y las áreas que deberá abarcar la misma. La Ley también crea el Comité de Ministros para el Fomento y Promoción de la Inversión Extranjera, que tendrá por objeto asesorar al Presidente de la República en las materias vinculadas al fomento y promoción de la inversión extranjera, estableciendo sus funciones y atribuciones. Asimismo, se crea la Agencia de Promoción de la Inversión Extranjera, la que deberá promover y atraer el ingreso de todo tipo de capitales e inversiones del exterior, estableciendo sus funciones y atribuciones.

Policy: Law No. 7/15 approving the General Labour Basic Law.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 314 articles divided ino fourteen Chapters, approves the General Labour Basic Law. It  applies to all workers who, in the territory of the Republic of Angola, perform a paid work on behalf of an employer, within the organization and under his authority and direction such as in public, mixed, private companies, agricultural cooperatives, social organizations, international organizations and in diplomatic and consular representations, foreigners hired in the country at the service of national employers. In addition, it applies to rural labour contract regime, extended by regulatory decree to workers in other activities, closely linked to agriculture, agro-forestry, livestock, and fisheries, provided that the exercise of such activities is dependent on climatic conditions or seasonal nature. Working women are guaranteed equal treatment of men and non-discrimination at work. They are guaranteed: Access to any job or profession; Equal opportunities and treatment in access to training and professional development actions; The right to equal pay for equal work or work of equal value; During pregnancy and after childbirth, working women have special rights without decreasing their wages, etc.

Policy: Act on trading greenhouse gas emission allowances.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes principles of functioning of the trading greenhouse gas emission allowances system. The aim of this system is to limit emissions in a more profitable and economically effective way. The system includes greenhouse gas emissions from installations and from aerial operations. The emissions from installations concern carbon dioxide (CO2), nitrous oxide (N2O) and perfluorocarbons (PFCs). The emissions from aerial operations concern carbon dioxide (CO2). The present Act is composed of the following sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Account management in the registry of European Union (Sec. 2); Administration of emission allowances held on accounts in the European Union registry and transfer of these allowances (Sec. 3); General provisions of granting allowances to installations (Sec. 4); Granting allowances for production other than production of electrical energy (Sec. 5); Granting allowances for installations producing electrical energy (Sec. 6); Granting allowances to operators of aircrafts (Sec. 7); Auctions of allowances (Sec. 8); Authorization for the emission of greenhouse gases (Sec. 9); Granting allowances to new installations (Sec. 10); Change of the allocated number of emission allowances in case of a significant reduction of the production capacity or partial or complete cessation of operations (Sec. 11); Monitoring of emissions from aerial operations and installations (Sec. 12); The use of emission reduction units and certified emission reduction units (Sec. 13); Administrative penalties (Sec. 14); Changes in valid provisions (Sec. 15); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 16).
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Regional Decree No. 136-pr “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure, to ensure availability and conservation of landmarks. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Gender and Agriculture Development Strategy II (GADS II).
Policy_Content: This Gender and Agriculture Development Strategy is the second cross-sectoral document of the kind that follows and completes the Gender and Agriculture Development Strategy (GADS I) of 2001. It aims at adopting gender mainstreaming approach to gender equality in the agriculture sector providing guidance to the concerned stakeholders to be more gender-responsive in their programming and interventions. Main goals are (i) provide guidance for integration of gender equality in the implementation of agricultural development policies and programs; (ii) give recognition to the potential that men, women, the youth and Persons Living with Disabilities (PLWDs) have in accelerating agricultural growth and development; (iii) recognize the threat that the HIV/AIDS epidemic poses to the sector; and (iv) highlight the need to obtain gender-disaggregated data for planning programs to meet the diverse needs of the different groups along the Agricultural Value Chain. To achieve the goals, nine strategic objectives have been set out as follows (i) strengthen institutional capacity for Gender-responsive policies, programmes, projects, budgets and monitoring and evaluation within MOFA; (ii)  enhance equitable delivery of agricultural services and access to inputs; (iii) enhance access to land, information on land rights and tenure security (iv) develop and disseminate gender-sensitive appropriate technology along the agricultural value chain including climate smart practices; (v) promote gender-responsive agribusiness, value-addition and market access for livelihood and growth in incomes; (vi)  promote gender-sensitive research and extension linkages; (vii) promote equal representation and participation in decision-making by women and men at all levels; (viii)  harness the potentials of vulnerable farmers for social protection along the Agricultural Value Chain; and (ix) strengthen gender co-ordination among key ministries, civil society, the private sector and development partners.

Strengthening the competitiveness of food producers (pag. 4).

Policy: National Youth Policy 2015-2020.
Policy_Content: The Cook Islands National Youth Policy is a national policy with a multi-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the policy is 5 years between 2015 and 2020. The purpose of this Policy is to provide guidance for the key areas of youth development that require strengthening and support from all sectors of society. This Policy focuses on young men and women between the ages of 15 - 24 years of age living in the Cook Islands taking into account all the issues facing the Youth of the Cook Islands. The priority areas of this Policy are: (I) family relationships, (II) education and economic opportunities, (III) empowering youth through community, cultural, spiritual and personal development, (IV) health, well-being and welfare, and (V) identifying youth at risk and increase their resilience.

Policy_Content: This National Strategy against Antibiotic Resistance 2015–2020 is a multi-sectoral policy document adopting a One Health approach.  Overarching goals of the National Strategy for the period 2015–2020 are: 1. Reduce the total use of antibiotics. 2. More appropriate use of antibiotics. 3. Improved knowledge of what drives the development and spread of antibiotic resistance. 4. Be a driver in international and normative work to improve access, responsible use, and development of new antibiotics, vaccines and better diagnostic tools.

Policy: Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC) of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia.
Policy_Content: This Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at laying out the adaptation initiatives, addressing both climate change adaptation and mitigation objectives, that Ethiopia intends to undertake in order to limit its net greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 2030. The INDC is in line with the Climate Resilient Green Economy Strategy (CRGE), integrated into the Second Growth and Transformation Plan that would ensure a resilient economic development pathway while decreasing per capita emissions by 64% to achieve the Vision of	achieving carbon neutrality, with the mid-term goal of attaining middle-income status.

Policy_Content: La Hoja de Ruta para hacer de El Salvador un país libre de trabajo infantil y sus peores formas es un documento adoptado por El Salvador, con el apoyo de la Organización Internacional del Trabajo, en el marco programático del Plan Quinquenal de Desarrollo 2015-2019 y de la Política Nacional de Protección Integral de la Niñez y la Adolescencia. El objetivo es articular esfuerzos nacionales para prevenir y erradicar el trabajo infantil, así como vincularse con otras políticas públicas que faciliten un abordaje integral de los derechos de la niñez y de la adolescencia. La Hoja de Ruta y su Programación Operativa para el período 2015-2017 aborda seis dimensiones estratégicas, a saber: 1) Lucha contra la pobreza; 2) Salud; 3) Educación; 4) Protección especial de derechos; 5) Sensibilización social; 6) Generación de conocimientos y mecanismos de seguimiento.

Policy: Order No. 182 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on ensuring sanitary safety in the forests.
Policy_Content: In order to ensure sanitary safety in the forests the following forestry protection measures shall be applied: (a) forest pathology research; (b) pest control arrangements; and (c) sanitary rehabilitation arrangements. In course of forestry pathology research shall be defined the boundaries of damaged forest areas, calculation of the number of pests and areas of disease spreading and assessment of the current state of forests. The scope of sanitary rehabilitation arrangements shall be improvement of forest plantations, reduction of spreading of pests and reduction of damages from adverse natural phenomena.

Policy: Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2015/893 as regards measures to prevent the introduction into and the spread within the Union of Anoplophora glabripennis (Motschulsky).
Policy_Content: This Decision sets out measures to prevent the introduction into and spread within the European Union of Anoplophora glabripennis (Motschulsky). It applies to plants for planting that have a stem diameter of 1 cm or more at their thickest point, other than seeds and planting materiales specified in article 1 (a). As regards imports originating in third countries where the specified organism is known to be present, those plants may only be introduced into the European Union if they fulfill the following conditions: (a) they comply with the specific import requirements, as set out in point 1 of Section 1(A) of Annex II; (b) on entry into the European Union they are inspected by the responsible official body in accordance with point 2 of Section 1(A) of Annex II for the presence of the specified organism, and no signs of that organism have been found. Article 3 concerns the importation of wood.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 570 validating Federal Target Program "Development of the Republic of Karelia until 2020”.
Policy_Content: Federal Target Program "Development of the Republic of Karelia until 2020” is a cross-sectoral regional policy document, setting forth the objectives of the development of the economic potential of the Republic of Karelia and its fulfilment, increasing the competitiveness of basic and the creation of new industries and sectors of the economy infrastructure support for economic development, and development of social sphere. The Republic of Karelia is focusing its efforts and resources on solving acute problems in the following areas: (a) infrastructure support for the economic development of the region; (b) economic growth, which is achieved primarily through the development of existing and the creation of new industries; (c) improving public-private partnerships; (d) rational nature management provided by balanced consumption and development of advanced technologies; and (e) improvement of the quality of life of the population. In the field of agro-industrial complex shall be implemented investment projects for the development of beef cattle breeding of Aberdeen-Angus breed with a production volume of 500 tons of meat in live weight per year and for the construction of a fish processing plant with a refrigerator for processing cod, haddock and other types of fish with a production capacity of over 30 thousand tons of raw materials per year. The aforesaid projects shall create new jobs.

Policy: Ordonnance sur la protection contre les substances et les préparations dangereuses (Ordonnance sur les produits chimiques, OChim).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution la loi du 15 décembre 2000 sur les produits chimiques, la loi du 7 octobre 1983 sur la protection de l’environnement, la loi fédérale du 24 janvier 1991 sur la protection des eaux. La présente ordonnance règle: a) l’analyse et l’évaluation des dangers et des risques que les substances et préparations peuvent entraîner pour la vie et la santé humaines ainsi que pour l’environnement; b) les conditions relatives à la mise sur le marché des substances et préparations susceptibles de mettre en danger l’être humain ou l’environnement; c) l’utilisation des substances et préparations susceptibles de mettre en danger l’être humain ou l’environnement; d) le traitement par les autorités d’exécution des données relatives aux substances et préparations. Le texte comprend 94 articles répartis en 7 Titres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Conditions de mise sur le marché (2); Obligations du fabricant subséquentes à la mise sur le marché (3); Règles de conduite lors de l’utilisation des substances, des préparations et des objets (4); Traitement des données (5); Exécution (6); Dispositions finales (7). Six annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Public health,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Data collection/reporting,Internal trade,Enforcement/compliance
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2015-615 du 4 juin 2015 relative à la mise sur le marché et à l'utilisation des matières fertilisantes, des adjuvants pour matières fertilisantes et des supports de culture.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance vise à moderniser et à simplifier les règles applicables aux matières fertilisantes et supports de culture, en précisant leur définition, les conditions dans lesquelles leur cession. Leur utilisation est subordonnée à une autorisation administrative.  Conformément aux dispositions de la loi d’avenir pour l’agriculture, l’alimentation et la forêt du 13 octobre 2014, ces autorisations administratives seront délivrées par le directeur général de l’agence nationale de sécurité sanitaire de l’alimentation, de l’environnement et du travail (Anses). Cette ordonnance traduit la volonté du Gouvernement de moderniser la réglementation applicable aux matières fertilisantes et supports de culture afin de favoriser tant les nombreuses innovations dans ce secteur, que le développement de nouveaux intrants, comme les biostimulants, permettant de limiter le recours aux produits chimiques de synthèse.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 258 validating the Regulation on regional state supervision in the field of protection and use of protected natural areas of regional significance.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for the performance by the competent regional executive body regional state supervision in the field of protection and management of protected natural areas of regional significance. Regional state supervision is aimed at preventing, identification and suppression of violations by legal entities, managers thereof and other officials, individual entrepreneurs, their authorized representatives and natural persons, of requirements in the field of protection and use of protected natural territories established in accordance with international treaties Russian Federation, federal laws and other regulatory legal acts of the Russian Federation adopted in accordance with them, regional laws and other regulatory legal acts, through the organization and performance of inspections of these persons and control measures for special protected natural areas and in their protective zones, the adoption measures stipulated by the legislation of the Russian Federation for suppression and (or) elimination of the consequences of revealed violations, as well as systematic monitoring of compliance with mandatory requirements, analysis and forecasting of the status of compliance with mandatory requirements in the process of performance by legal entities, individual entrepreneurs and citizens of their activities. Regional state supervision shall be performed by the Regional Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology.

Policy: Regional Law No. 551-OZ “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers, advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government, public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 41/289 validating the Regulation on nature monument of regional significance “Medvedsky Bor”.
Policy_Content: Nature monument of regional significance “Medvedsky Bor” is constituted in order to preserve the relict pine forest on sand dunes with karst landforms – places of growth (habitat) of rare and endangered species, including steppe, plant and animal species and is protected natural area of regional significance. In accordance with the status of protected natural area of regional significance on the territory of a natural monument, any activity that entails a violation of the preservation of the natural monument shall be prohibited. The following particular activities shall be prohibited on the territory of nature monument of regional significance “Medvedsky Bor”: (a) tapping of trees; (b) procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, except for procurement and harvesting thereof by citizens for individual personal needs; (c) industrial harvesting of edible non-timber products; (d) allotment of land plots for hunting; (e) hunting for birds in nesting period (from 1 April to 15 July); (f) agricultural activities; (g) exploration and mining; (h) modification of hydrological regime and drainage; (i) transit and grazing of farm animals; (j) application of toxic chemicals and fertilizers; (k) burning of vegetation and destruction of nests, rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; and (l) waste disposal.

Policy: Regulation of Ministry of Environment and Forestry of R.I. No. P.21/MenLHK-II/2015 on Administration of Forestry Products originating from Private Forests.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 19 articles divided into seven Chapters and four Appendices, establishes the administrative procedures for forestry products originating from Private Forests. The administration of the private forest products is intended to control the circulation of forestry products aimed at protecting the rights, private rights and legal certainty in the ownership/control and transportation of forestry products from private forests. Forestry products use from private forest does not need logging permission. The certificate of origin of forestry products originating from private forests are either: a) Form of Transport; or b) SKAU (Letter of Origin). Every private forest products to be transported from the location of harvest or collection points around the logging area to the destination point, must have either Form of Transport or Letter of Origin (SKAU), which is a transport document for transporting private forests products that applies to the entire territory of the Republic of Indonesia. The use of Letter of Origin (SKAU) is used in the private forests outside Java, Bali and Lombok.

Policy: Estrategia de Municipios, Comunas y Comunidades Saludables.
Policy_Content: La presente Estrategia apunta a contribuir al fortalecimiento del rol del Municipio como actor relevante y agente de cambio en la creación de entornos saludables para la población, incluyendo para una alimentación más saludable. Contempla los fundamentos de la estrategia, la metodología a seguir y el modelo de gestión en sus diversas fases de implementación, ajustada a una visión territorial, participativa, integral sectorial e intersectorial con foco en la equidad. Los instrumentos de gestión territorial disponibles para estos fines incluyen los Planes de Desarrollo Comunal, Planos reguladores, presupuestos Municipales, ordenanzas municipales, decretos alcaldicios, entre otros, que pueden intervenir en los distintos componentes de salud pública. Asimismo, se promueve el fortalecimiento de la gestión pública participativa, mediante la capacitación de dirigentes sociales para el ejercicio de la ciudadanía en salud y la implementación de mecanismos de participación social, que permita la construcción colectiva y ejecución de un Plan Trienal de Municipios, Comunas y Comunidades Saludables.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 343 validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of regional significance “Tumbotinsky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “Tumbotinsky” shall be classified as complex landscape reserve and it shall perform the following functions: (a) maintaining ecological balance; (b) preservation of natural complexes (typical and unique for the region of biocenoses, including steppe forests, floodplain oak forest, peat bogs, reservoirs of karst origin) and their components (rare species of living organisms and their habitat) in their natural state; (c) preservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources (preservation of water protection properties of forests and swamps; protection of cranberries, hunting fauna resources). The purpose of the reserve: environment-forming, scientific (landscape, zoological, botanical), water protection, recreational, protection of the gene pool (rare species of animals and plants) and protection of the cenosis fund (typical biocenoses). The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve of regional significance “Tumbotinsky”: (a) privatization and sale of land; (b) construction; (c) allotment of land for gardening and horticulture; (d) exploration of subsoil and mining; (e) g) laying through the territory of communications not related to the functioning of nature monument; (f) ploughing up; (g) exploration and mining; (h) blasting operations; (i) drainage and irrigation; (j) waste disposal; (k) effluent waste water discharge in watercourses; (l) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and plant protection means; (l) clear cutting and procurement of soft resin; (m) creation of forest plantations; (n) off road movement and parking of motor vehicles; (o) recreational and sport hunting wit the use of traps; (p) navigation on motor small-size vessels; and (q) organization of tourist camps and making fires.

Policy: Decreto Nº 686 - Reglamento General de la Ley Orgánica de los Consejos Nacionales para la Igualdad.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto expide el Reglamento General de la Ley Orgánica de los Consejos Nacionales para la Igualdad, que norma la organización de los Consejos Nacionales para la Igualdad. Los Consejos Nacionales para la Igualdad son: 1) De Género, como órgano responsable de asegurar la plena vigencia y el ejercicio de los derechos de las mujeres y las personas LGBTI, y responsable de garantizar la igualdad de género; 2) Intergeneracional, como órgano responsable de velar por la plena vigencia y el ejercicio de los derechos de niñas, niños, adolescentes, jóvenes, adultas y adultos mayores, y las relaciones intergeneracionales; 3) De pueblos y nacionalidades, como órgano responsable de velar por la plena vigencia y el ejercicio de los derechos de las comunas, comunidades, pueblos y nacionalidades indígenas, el pueblo afroecuatoriano y el pueblo montubio, y las relaciones interculturales de la sociedad ecuatoriana; 4) De discapacidades, como órgano responsable de velar por la plena vigencia y el ejercicio de los derechos de las personas con discapacidad, y su inclusión en la sociedad; 5) De movilidad humana, como órgano responsable de velar por la plena vigencia y de los derechos de las personas en situación de movilidad humana, en observancia de la Constitución y los instrumentos internacionales.

Policy: Law of Georgia on the Business Ombudsman of Georgia (No. 3612-IIS of 2015)
Policy_Content: This Law defines the powers, main principles and forms of activities of the Business Ombudsman of Georgia ('Business Ombudsman'). This Law is intended to facilitate protection of rights and legitimate interests related to the performance of entrepreneurial activities of persons in the territory of Georgia. The Business Ombudsman shall be independent in exercising his/her powers. Any exertion of influence on, or interference in, the activities of the Business Ombudsman shall be prohibited. The Business Ombudsman shall, in the process of his/her activities, comply with the principles of justice, objectivity, impartiality and legality. When reviewing an application, the Business Ombudsman shall be neutral and shall not represent an applicant or the administrative body whose decision/action is discredited by the applicant. The Business Ombudsman shall try to reach a consensus by maintaining a fair balance between the interests of the parties. The Business Ombudsman shall have the right not to testify about facts disclosed to him/her as the Business Ombudsman. The Business Ombudsman shall reserve this right even after termination of his/her authority. The Business Ombudsman shall supervise the protection of rights and legitimate interests related to the performance of entrepreneurial activities of persons in the territory of Georgia, and detect violations of these rights and legitimate interests, and facilitate the restoration of violated rights of persons in compliance with the rule established by this Law. The Business Ombudsman shall protect the rights and legitimate interests of persons related to the performance of entrepreneurial activities through: (a) responding to individual and joint applications; (b) detecting deficiencies in the legislation of Georgia and in practise; and (c) carrying out informational and advisory activities.

Policy: Decision No. 734/QD-TTg approving the adjusted master plan on socio-economic development of Dong Nai province through 2020, with a vision toward 2025.
Policy_Content: This Decision approves the adjusted master plan on socio-economic development of Dong Nai province through 2020, with a vision toward 2025, with the following principal contents: To further bring into play the existing comparative advantages and internal resources in association with mobilizing external resources to maintain a fast and stable growth rate. To develop industries in depth and in an environment-friendly manner, prioritize the attraction of investment in hi-tech industrial projects and supporting industries of mechanical engineering, electricity and electronics. To focus on development of specialized zones such as the biotechnology application center, the Long Thanh hi-tech industrial park, the Dofico industrial agricultural complex, and supporting industry zones within operating industrial parks. To combine economic development and social progress and ecosystem protection, raise the living standards of people of all strata, especially workers, rationally and efficiently protect and use natural resources and environment, and build spacious, civilized and modem urban centers and rural areas. To closely combine the province's socio-economic development with the overall development of the southeastern region, the southern key economic region, coordinate with other localities in building infrastructure, protecting the environment, training human resources and increasing the province's scientific and technological potential. To combine economic development with national defense and security consolidation, earmark resources for building and consolidating the all-people defense posture associated with people's security posture, and firmly maintain social order and safety and political stability for socio-economic development in the locality.

Policy: Order No. 101 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the Regulation on the requirements and conditions of security (licensing conditions) for the processing of uranium ores.
Policy_Content: These Licensing Conditions establish the basic requirements and conditions for the safety of the processing of uranium ores. These Licensing Terms shall be mandatory for entities engaged in the field of the use of nuclear energy who conduct or intend to conduct activities for the processing of uranium ores, including termination through liquidation, conversion, temporary cessation (conservation) processing of uranium site, regardless of ownership and subordination to public administration. Upon the termination of uranium ore processing, a uranium processing facility is considered as a set of major industrial facilities and auxiliary facilities that belonged to the production infrastructure of the uranium processing facility during its operation. Business entity operating in the field of the use of nuclear energy performs activities related to the processing of uranium ores, including cessation of the activity of the processing uranium facility, subject to obtaining a license for the processing of uranium ores, in accordance with the procedure established by law. Business entity operating in the field of processing of uranium ores must perform assessment and analysis of the radiation safety level of facility processing uranium ores and must make report of the safety analysis. Business entity operating in the field of nuclear energy management shall ensure storage of byproducts of uranium ore processing at specially equipped sites and facilities that minimize the migration of radionuclides to ground and subsoil components of the natural environment. Business entity operating in the field of nuclear energy management during the processing of uranium ore shall ensure storage of uranium ore processing waste in the tailings storage facility.

Policy: Décret n° 2015-679 du 26 mai 2015 portant création d’un Cadre harmonisé de suivi-évaluation des politiques publiques (CASE).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée Cadre harmonisé chargé de développer et de coordonner tous les mécanismes et instruments de l’Etat en matière de suivi-évaluation des politiques publiques. Ici, le suivi évaluation d’une politique publique consiste à rechercher, si les moyens juridiques, administratifs ou financiers mis en œuvre permettent de produire les effets attendus de cette politique et d’atteindre les objectifs qui lui sont assignés. Le Cadre harmonisé est chargé : du suivi de l’exécution des politiques publiques ainsi que des plans, projets, programmes et réformes qui les sous-tendent; de l’évaluation périodique des politiques publiques, à travers l’analyse de leurs effets et impacts sur les populations et l’environnement ; du recueil, du partage et de la diffusion des résultats des politiques publiques.

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy (Direct Payments etc.) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015 (S.S.I. No. 215 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Common Agricultural Policy (Direct Payments etc.) (Scotland) Regulations 2015 so as to make provision for the exercise of derogations in respect of deadlines for relevant applications, to remove references to specific species of grass which are required where a farmer wishes to meet his or her Ecological Focus Areas (EFA) requirement by under-sowing grass and to insert new Schedules 3 and 4. Schedule 3 makes provision for a voluntary coupled support scheme in Scotland in favour of bovine and ovine animals that are born on the farmer’s holding and in respect of which the relevant eligibility criteria are met. Schedule 4 lists which breeds of cattle are ineligible for support. These Regulations also amend the Common Agricultural Policy (Cross-Compliance) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 in respect to standards for good agricultural and environmental condition regarding, among other things, use of pesticides and protection of watercourses from cultivation practices.

Policy: Chemicals Act (Control of Major Accident Hazards Involving Dangerous Substances) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 209 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations transpose Directive 2012/18/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control of major accident hazards involving dangerous substances, amending and subsequently repealing Council Directive 96/82/EC” (SEVESO III Directive). They amend the Chemical Acts 2008 and 2010 in section 2. The purpose of these Regulations is to lay down rules for the prevention of major accidents involving dangerous substances, and to seek to limit as far as possible the consequences for human health and the environment of such accidents when they occur, with the overall objective of providing a high level of protection in a consistent and effective manner.The hazard categories of the dangerous substances in Schedule 1 reflects the classification, labelling and packaging of chemicals (‘CLP’) system introduced by Regulation (EC) No. 1272/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council on classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures. Furthermore, a mechanism has been introduced for the assessment of the major accident potential for a particular substance to determine whether it should be included or excluded from the scope of Directive 2012/18/EU and therefore from these Regulations.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 287/2015 “On the Strategy of national security of Ukraine”.
Policy_Content: The President defines risks to national security in the following spheres: (a) energy security – distortion of market mechanisms in the energy sector; insufficient level of diversification of sources of energy supplies and technologies; criminalization and corruption of the energy sector; ineffective policy of energy efficiency and energy supply; and (b) environmental security - excessive anthropogenic impact and high level of man-made pressure on the territory of Ukraine; negative environmental consequences of the Chernobyl disaster; a significant amount of domestic and non-domestic waste and an inadequate level of their recycling, re-processing and utilization; unsatisfactory state of the unified civil protection system, environmental monitoring system. Priorities for ensuring Ukraine's energy security shall be as follows: (a) reforming energy markets, integration of Ukraine's energy sector with the energy markets of the EU and the European energy security system; (b) increase of energy efficiency and energy saving; (c) diversification of sources and routes of energy supply, development of renewable and nuclear energy with the consideration of ecological, nuclear and radiation safety; and (d) creation of conditions for reliable energy supply and transit of energy resources on the territory of Ukraine. Priorities for ensuring Ukraine's environmental security shall be as follows: (a) ecosystem preservation; (b) creation of efficient environmental monitoring system; (c) sustainable use of natural resources; (d) pollution control of the environment, atmospheric air, surface and underground waters, reduction of pollution level and restoration of soil fertility; (e) clean-up of the territory from industrial and consumer waste; (f) creation of the system of waste recycling; (g) mitigation of the consequences of Chernobyl disaster; and (h) prevention of import to the national territory of hazardous technologies, substances, materials, transgenic plants and pathogens.

Policy: National rural development programme 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: This Programme stipulates the the new Romania National rural development programme for the period from 2014 to 2020. This Programme, with scope of action on the entire Romanian national territory, is aimed at implementing many cross-sectoral issues related to the development of all national rural areas, principally setting the indicators regarding different parts such as employment rate of the population by economic activity, rural population and its structure, effective unemployment rate, agricultural areas occupied by organic farming, development rate of independent rural activities, direct use of energy in food industry present in rural areas. The content of this text are divided into 21 Chapters, each with diverse subsections. List of basic contents with some significant issues mentioned is here as follows: Title of the rural development programme; Member state or administrative region (Geographical area covered by the programme; classification of the region); Ex-ante evaluation (Description of the process, including timing of main events, intermediate reports, in relation to the key stages of RDP development; Structured table containing the recommendations of the ex-ante evaluation and how they have been addressed); Swot analysis and identification of needs (Comprehensive overall description of the current situation of the programming area, based on common and programme-specific context indicators and other qualitative up-to-date information; Adapting the research activities and the results of research to the needs of farmers and processors; Adequate and quality advisory and consultancy; Restructuring and modernization of small farms into market-oriented farms; Low level of greenhouse gase (GHG) emissions from agriculture and the transition towards a low carbon economy); Description of the strategy (A justification of the needs selected to be addressed by the RDP, and the choice of objectives, priorities, focus areas and the target setting based on evidence from the SWOT and the needs assessment; Fostering knowledge transfer and innovation in agriculture, forestry and rural areas; Enhancing farm viability and competitiveness of all types of agriculture in all regions and promoting innovative farm technologies and the sustainable management of forests; Promoting food chain organisation, including processing and marketing of agricultural products, animal welfare and risk management in agriculture). In the Chapter 8 there is a detailed description of selected measures.

The Organisation shall, among other things: (a) organise tests and do everything necessary to ensure compliance with standards designated and approved by the Council; (b) (b) undertake investigation as necessary into the quality of facilities, systems, services, materials and product, whether imported or manufactured in Nigeria; (c) evaluate quality assurance activities, including certification of systems, products and laboratories throughout Nigeria; (d) ensure reference standards for calibration and verification of measures and measuring instruments; (e) establish an Import and Export Product Surveillance, Certification and Conformity Assessment Scheme; (f) establish a mandatory conformity assessment programme for locally manufactured products in Nigeria.

Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe le cadre juridique et institutionnel des investissements privés, nationaux ou étrangers réalisés en République de Guinée, en vue de favoriser: la création, l’extension, la diversification, la modernisation des entreprises et/ou des infrastructures, des prestations de services et de l'artisanat; la création d'emplois décents et durables, la formation des cadres nationaux et l'émergence d'une main-d’œuvre nationale qualifiée; l'apport des capitaux étrangers ainsi que la mobilisation de l'épargne nationale; la transformation et la valorisation des matières premières locales en priorité; l'investissement dans les industries exportatrices et dans les secteurs économiques valorisant les ressources naturelles et produits locaux, à fort potentiel de main d'œuvre; la création et le développement d'entreprises nouvelles, notamment les Petites et Moyennes Entreprises; la restructuration, la compétitivité, l'intégration et la croissance des entreprises; le transfert des technologies adaptées au besoin de développement du pays; les investissements en milieu rural et dans toutes les régions du pays pour améliorer les conditions de vie des populations locales; la reprise pour la réhabilitation ou l'extension d'entreprises par de nouveaux investisseurs; la promotion du Partenariat Public-Privé et d'un tissu économique performant et complémentaire; l'utilisation des technologies locales et la recherche-développement; la promotion de l'industrie verte et la diversification des produits à l'exportation; la protection de l'environnement, l'intégration économique sous régionale et régionale.

Policy: Instruction No. 1027/MOIC.DIMEX on the Export of Finished Wooden Products Purchased at Exhibition.
Policy_Content: This Instruction aims to overcome the overlapping procedure for the export of wooden products purchased from exhibitions, to facilitate the export of wooden products. The Minister of Industry and Commerce hereby notifies following implementations: The export of wooden products purchased from exhibitions in Lao PDR that are permitted in correspondence to laws and regulations shall follow the conditions and procedures as prescribed below: I. Requirements for the export of wooden products purchased at exhibition Wooden products purchased from exhibitions with the purpose of export shall meet following requirements: 1. Category and size of wooden products shall comply with the Decision of the Minister of Industry and Commerce No. 1415/MOC.DIMEX, dated 28 August 2008 on Categories and Size of Wooden Products and relevant laws and regulations. 2. Wooden products shown at the exhibitions shall have legal source, correct duty payment and written certificate from responsible committee at the exhibition. 3. The value of wooden products purchased from the exhibition for export shall not exceed 160.000.000 Kip (One hundred and sixty millions kip) per exporter (at one time). If the value of the wooden products exceeds 160.000.000 Kip (One hundred and sixty millions kip) per set, the export shall not exceed one set.

Policy: Act No. LVII of 2015 concerning energy efficiency.
Policy_Content: This Act comprises nine chapters. The purpose of this Act is to identify actions aiming to achive national energy efficiency goals and, to this end, to ensure the comprehensive energy supply and energy use efficiency, to reduce energy costs for end users and preserve environmental resources for future generations. Chapter I contains general provisions. Chapter II lays down the duties of the central administration in implementing energy efficiency goals and addresses strategic documents. Chapter III concerns tasks of the central administration in relation with energy efficiency. Chapter IV sets out the energy efficiency tasks of public institutions. Chapter V contains improving measures of energy efficiency for energy saving at the end user level. Chapter VI concerns the efficient running of various facilities, thermal energy supplying networks and industrial plants producing waste heat. Chapter VII contains rules on consumer and market actors information. Chapter VIII provides for energy audit. Chapter IX lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Data collection/reporting,Energy conservation/energy production,Environmental audit,Environmental planning
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: On 8 June 2015.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 291 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persona and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 10.371 creating the State Development Programme for Municipalities Exploiting Oil and Gas (PRODEMP).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 5 articles, creates the State Development Programme for Municipalities Exploiting Oil and Gas (PRODEMP). It establishes that the State Executive bodies shall, within their respective areas of operation, design and develop supporting policies, partnership and technical guidance to municipalities capixabas producers of oil and gas, in particular to promote: the exchange of legal and tax information considering the expansion of tax collection of the State and the Municipalities; the realization, together with the municipalities of capacity building programmes enabling state and municipal employees to monitoring the companies operating in the oil and gas sectors and to properly enforce public revenues arising from them; designing a state policy for attracting private investments, focusing on complementary activities of the oil industry, based on the identification of the economic potential of each of the oil producing municipalities, as well as the municipalities located in the surrounding area; carrying out technical studies, involving legal and economic elements, which also will be based on identifying the economic potential of oil producing municipalities, in order to define the taxation resulting from oil and gas exploitation.

Policy: Co-operatives (National Uniform Legislation) Act.
Policy_Content: This Act provides a legislative framework for the formation, registration and operation of co-operatives. The Co-operatives National Law is set out in the Appendix to this Act: a) applies as a law of this jurisdiction; b) as so applying may be referred to as the Co-operatives National Law (NT); and c) as so applying, is a part of this Act. The Co-operatives National Regulations: a) apply as National Regulations in force for the Co-operatives National Law (NT), subject to modifications prescribed by the local regulations; and b) as so applying, may be referred to as the Co-operatives National Regulations (NT). Requirements and proceedings for cooperatives are specified in the text consisting of 624 sections divided into eight Chapters and completed by four Schedules, as follows: Preliminary (Chap. 1); Formation, powers and constitution of co-operatives (Chap. 2); Management and operation of co-operatives (Chap. 3); Structural and other events for co-operatives (Chap. 4); Participating co-operatives (Chap. 5); Supervision and protection of co-operatives (Chap. 6); Legal proceedings and other matters (Chap. 7); and General (Chap. 8). Schedules deal with the following issues: Matters for which rules of co-operative must make provision (Sc. 1); Relevant interests, associates, and related corporations (Sc. 2); Savings and transitional provisions (Sc. 3); Miscellaneous provisions relating to interpretation (Sc. 4).

Policy: Regional Law No. 35-Z “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers, advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government, public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

Policy: Law (2015: 280) on reporting of accidents in offshore oil and gas operations outside the European Union.
Policy_Content: This Law implements for Sweden Directive 2013/30/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on safety of offshore oil and gas operations. Provisions related to the implementation of the Directive are also contained in the Act (1966: 314) the continental shelf, in the Mining Act (1991:45) and in the Public Access and Secrecy Act (2009:400). The Law requires a company that is registered in Sweden to report, upon request of the regulatory authority, on the circumstances of a serious accident that the company, or its subsidiary, have been involved in during offshore oil or gas operations outside the European Union. The government or the authority that the government designates (the supervisory authority may issue rules on the obligation to report a serious accident. The supervisory authority supervises that this Law and Regulations  made under it shall be observed. The supervisory authority may decide on the injunctions required for enforcement.

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté détermine les règlements d’urbanisme et de construction au Rwanda. Ce règlement définit notamment la planification urbaine; le Code d’Urbanisme (critères de définition des centres urbains, infrastructures publiques de base, objectifs et prescriptions des développements de chantier, objectifs et prescriptions de lotissement, restructuration et remembrements de parcelle; paramètres de développement de parcelle basés sur les principes de zonage, catégorisation de l’usage des terres urbaines, principes de conceptions du voisinage, terres requises pour les routes urbaines et mobilité efficace, planification d’approvisionnement en eau, la gestion des eaux pluviales et le contrôle d'érosion, la planification du traitement des déchets solides et liquides, les standards et procédures pour le renouvellement urbain, guide pour mettre en œuvre des documents d'urbanisme). Afin d’assurer la protection de l’environnement, le Code d'urbanisme détermine clairement les activités prohibés dans les zones suivantes: zones de plaines inondables et marais; sources d'eau, plans d'eau et leurs bassins versants ; pentes raides, crêtes et sommets ; forêts naturels et les zones de reboisement; et zones de risque sismique et volcanique.

Policy: INTENDED NATIONALLY DETERMINED CONTRIBUTIONS (INDCs).
Policy_Content: This INDC is a nationwide multi-sectoral policy document. The INDC highlights Tanzania's adaptation  contributions. Tanzania  will  embark  on  a  climate  resilient  development  pathway.   In  doing  so  the adaptation  contributions  will  reduce  climate  related  disasters  from  70%  to  50%,  and significantly  reduce  the  impacts  of  spatial  and  temporal  variability  of  declining  rainfall, frequent  droughts  and  floods  which  have  long  term  implications  to  all  productive sectors  and  ecosystems,  particularly  the  agricultural  sector,  according to the INDC.  Access  to  clean  and  safe water  will  be  increased  from  60%  to  75%  and,  based  on  a  conservative  and  a  worst-case scenario  of  50cm  and  1m  sea-level  rise,  the  contributions  will  verifiably  reduce  the impacts  of  sea  level  rise  to  the  island  and  coastal  communities,  infrastructure  and ecosystems.   Adaptation  priority  sectors  are:  Agriculture, Livestock,  Coastal  and  Marine  Environment,  Fisheries,  Water  resources,  Forestry,   Human  Settlement, Energy, etc. Identified  mitigation  priority  sectors  are:  Energy, Transport, Forestry and Waste  management.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 302 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Act on substances that deplete the ozone layer and on some fluorinated greenhouse gases.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Act is to prevent and reduce emissions of substances that deplete the ozone layer and fluorinated greenhouse gases covered by the Kyoto Protocol. The present Act regulates: (1) duties of entities dealing with production and services related to the use of substances that deplete the ozone layer and fluorinated greenhouse gases, and trade in these substances and gases, and products, devices, systems of fire protection, fire extinguishers and air conditioning systems in certain motor vehicles; (2) duties of authorities competent in matters related to substances that deplete the ozone layer and fluorinated greenhouse gases; (3) sanctions for violating regulations concerning substances that deplete the ozone layer and on some fluorinated greenhouse gases. The text is composed of the following Sections: (1) General provisions; (2) Obligation of keeping records by operators of fire protection devices and systems; (3) Specialized unit; (4) Central register of operators of fire protection devices and systems; (5) Certification; (6) Appeal commitree; (7) Duties of entities dealing with air conditioning systems in certain motor vehicles; (8) Reporting on substances that deplete the ozone layer and fluorinated greenhouse gases; (9) Authorities competent in substances that deplete the ozone layer and fluorinated greenhouse gases; (10) Control; (11) Administrative fines and criminal provisions; (12) Changes in valid provisions; (13) Transitional and final provisions.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 10 July 2015.

Policy: ORDER no. 1,643 / C of the Ministry of Justice validating Internal Regulations of the National Anti-Corruption Division.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that National Anti-Corruption Division is organized as a structure with legal personality within the Prosecutor's Office attached to the High Court of Cassation and Justice and specializes in combating corruption offences, according to the law. The Prosecutor's Office attached to the High Court of Cassation and Justice resolves the conflicts of competence between the National Anti-Corruption Division and other structures or units within the Public Ministry. National Anti-Corruption Division is organized at central level and at territorial level. At the central level, the National Anti-Corruption Division is organized into departments, services, offices and compartments by types of activity. National Anti-Corruption Division shall combat crimes assimilated to corruption offences, procurement of goods, works and services for public authorities, economic and financial macro-crimes. National Anti-Corruption Division is led by a chief prosecutor, assimilated to the first Deputy Prosecutor General of the Prosecutor's Office attached to the High Court of Cassation and Justice. This Order establishes the internal hierarchy of National Anti-Corruption Division, attributing competence, functions and responsibilities to offices and departments within the framework of National Anti-Corruption Division.

Policy: Decreto Nº 38954-MTSS-MDHIS-MIDEPLAN ─ Implementación y articulación de la Estrategia de Atención a la Pobreza en Costa Rica denominada “Puente al Desarrollo”.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba la implementación y articulación de la Estrategia de Atención a la Pobreza en Costa Rica denominada “Puente al Desarrollo”, como mecanismo de articulación de los programas, proyectos y acciones que buscan garantizar el efectivo derecho de acceso a los bienes, servicios y productos que ofertan las instituciones y organizaciones públicas y privadas a nivel nacional dirigidos a personas en condición de pobreza. La Estrategia tiene dos componentes: Pobreza y Pobreza Extrema. El objetivo general del componente Pobreza es atender la pobreza de las familias desde un enfoque multisectorial e interinstitucional, procurando el acceso al sistema de protección social, al desarrollo de capacidades, al vínculo con el empleo y la empresariedad, a las ventajas de la tecnología, a la vivienda digna y al desarrollo territorial, mitigando la desigualdad y respetando los enfoques definidos como estratégicos, en aras del desarrollo humano e inclusión social. El objetivo general del componente Pobreza Extrema es reducir la pobreza extrema garantizando el acceso de la población a la oferta articulada, preferente, sostenible e integral de programas y servicios interinstitucionales.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 80/2015 approving the revision of the Legal Framework for Territorial Management Instruments, approved by Decree-Law No. 380/99.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 206 articles divided into ten Chapters, approves the revision of the Legal Framework for Territorial Management Instruments, approved by Decree-Law No. 380/99. It develops the basis of public policy for soil conservation and rehabilitation, land use and urban planning, defining the coordination system at the national, regional, inter-municipal and municipal levels of the territorial management system, the general land use regime and the elaboration, approval, execution and evaluation regime of territorial management instruments. The policy of territorial planning and urbanism is based on the territorial management system, which is organized, within a framework of coordinated interaction, in four areas: a) National scope; b) Regional scope; c) Intercity scope; d) Municipal scope. The National scope is achieved through the following instruments: a) National programme of territorial planning policy; b) Sectoral programmes; c) Special programmes. The Regional scope is achieved through regional programmes. The inter-municipal scope is achieved through the following instruments: a) Intercity programmes; b) Inter-municipal master plan; c) Inter-municipal urbanization plans; d) Intercity detail plans. The municipal scope is achieved through the following plans: a) Municipal master plan; b) Urbanization plans; c) Detailed plans.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 181-a “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 125 - Normas para el manejo forestal sostenible de los bosques húmedos.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide las Normas para el manejo forestal sostenible (MFS) para aprovechamiento de los bosques húmedos, que tiene por objeto regular el manejo forestal de los bosques húmedos, utilizando los principios, criterios e indicadores establecidos para fomentar el MFS. Se entiende el MFS como un concepto holístico y comprensivo, que toma en consideración el uso múltiple de los bosques y aspectos del paisaje y que está orientado a la obtención de beneficios de variados productos, bienes y servicios, con el fin de mejorar las condiciones y la calidad de vida de las personas sin poner en riesgo la satisfacción de las mismas y de las generaciones futuras. Dos aspectos guiarán las intervenciones silviculturales: 1) la resiliencia, la capacidad del bosque de absorber cambios y persistir a pesar de ellos; y 2) la estabilidad, la capacidad de volver a un estado de equilibrio después de una perturbación temporal. La norma se aplicará en los bosques húmedos ubicados en la región amazónica, en la provincia de Esmeraldas y otros lugares donde predomine este tipo de bosques.

Policy: Decreto Nº 677 - Crea el banco público denominado BANECUADOR B.P.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el banco público denominado BANECUADOR B.P., como una entidad financiera que forma parte del Sector Financiero Público, con personalidad jurídica propia y jurisdicción nacional, con patrimonio autónomo, autonomía técnica, administrativa, financiera y presupuestaria. El objeto del Banco será el ejercicio de actividades financieras previamente autorizadas por la Superintendencia de Bancos, y la prestación de servicios financieros de crédito, ahorro e inversión, bajo el criterio de intermediación financiera de recursos públicos y privados, atendiendo a la micro, pequeña y mediana empresa y empresas asociativas en sectores de producción, principalmente de agro negocios, comercio y servicios, con claro enfoque de desarrollo local y con preferencias en áreas rurales y urbano marginales, coadyuvando al fortalecimiento del Plan Nacional del Buen Vivir, a través de mecanismos de banca de primer y segundo piso.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Institution,Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Credit,Non-governmental entity,Cooperative/producer organization
