Policy: Regional Law No. 3627-OZ “On allotment of plots of land free of charge in ownership to some categories of citizens”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of allotment free of charge of public land plots pertaining to the regional or municipal public land stock in ownership to some categories of citizens. The following categories of citizens shall have the right of allotment free of charge of public land in ownership: (a) multi-child families (with three and more dependent children); (b) citizens that have lost the only residential facility they have owned as a result of natural disaster; (c) citizens awarded with the Order the Hero of the Soviet Union, Hero of the Russian Federation, Hero of Socialist Labour, Hero of Labour of the Russian Federation, Full Cavalier of the Order of Military Glory and Full Cavalier of the Order of Labour Glory. Plots of land shall be granted within the boundaries of municipal district of permanent residence. Plots of land can be allotted once-only for the following purposes: (a) individual housing construction; and (b) subsidiary small-holding and family farming.

Policy: Order No. 370 on criteria assessment for municipal projects on river restoration.
Policy_Content: This Order sets rules concerning the Danish Nature Agency's assessment, prioritization and decisions when granting subsidies to municipal river restoration projects in period. Criteria for being awarded subsidy include projects to be implemented in period 2009-2015 and concretely aiming at improving environment goals without causing damages to the habitat. Policy: Acuerdo Nº 61 - Reforma el Libro VI de la Calidad Ambiental, del Texto Unificado de la Legislación Secundaria del Ministerio del Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo reforma el Libro VI, sobre la Calidad ambiental, que establece los procedimientos y regula las actividades y responsabilidades públicas y privadas en materia de calidad ambiental, en aspectos relacionados pevalentemente con los procedimientos para la elaboración de las normas de calidad ambiental. Se entiende por calidad ambiental al conjunto de características del ambiente y la naturaleza que incluye el aire, el agua, el suelo y la biodiversidad, en relación a la ausencia o presencia de agentes nocivos que puedan afectar al mantenimiento y regeneración de los ciclos vitales, estructura, funciones y procesos evolutivos de la naturaleza. Los principios contenidos en este Libro son de aplicación obligatoria y constituyen los elementos conceptuales que originan, sustentan, rigen e inspiran todas las decisiones y actividades públicas, privadas, de las personas naturales y jurídicas, pueblos, nacionalidades y comunidades respecto a la gestión sobre la calidad ambiental, así como la responsabilidad por daños ambientales.  El Ministerio del Ambiente ejerce las potestades de Autoridad Ambiental Nacional y como tal ejerce la rectoría del Sistema Nacional Descentralizado de Gestión Ambiental y del Sistema Único de Manejo Ambiental y sus instrumentos. La licencia ambiental de cualquier naturaleza corresponde exclusivamente a la Autoridad Ambiental Nacional,.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 104-pa “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.

Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. Policy: Presidential Decree No. 1030 validating the State Program of Infrastructure Development.
Policy_Content: State Program of Infrastructure Development for the period of 2015-2019 establishes the goal of integration of transport infrastructure into the international transport system, realization of transit potential to ensure long-term economic Kazakhstan growth. It envisages strengthening energy infrastructure within the framework of the united electric power system and modernization (reconstruction and construction) of infrastructure of housing and communal services and heat, water supply and sewerage. The electricity industry fully covers the need of the national economy and the population with electric energy, but at the same time, it should develop at a faster pace. With the growth of hub cities and second cities of the second level will increase the need for electricity. The most important task of strengthening the country's unified energy supply system is the development of the backbone of the national electric network (NES). In order to increase the reliability of power supply of East Kazakhstan and Almaty regions and strengthening transit in the direction of "North-South "JSC" KEGOC implements the project “Construction of 500 kV Transit North-East-South". This will connect the energy supply of the north, east and south regions of the country, reduce dependence on external suppliers and effectively redistribute energy in case of shortage, in addition, positively affect the cost of electricity, which, in turn, will affect reducing the cost of goods, works and services in the economy. In order to solve the problem of reducing the deterioration of heat, water and sewerage systems, as well as repair and replacement of heat generating capacities will be adopted a set of measures for modernization (reconstruction and construction) of housing and communal sector. To this purpose, substantiations for the appropriateness of investments in the development of heat supply systems shall be elaborated, as well as criteria for selection and priority of project implementation in the regions shall be defined. About 1 thousand km of heat supply networks and about 6 thousand km of water supply and sewerage networks with the greatest losses and the highest accident rate will be modernized.
Subject: Energy, Water

Policy: Regional Decree No. 289 validating the Regulation on protected natural tourist recreational area of regional significance “Lisitsyno”.
Policy_Content: Protected natural tourist recreational area of regional significance “Lisitsyno” shall have as its purpose conservation of natural landscape and ensuring organized tourism and recreation. The objects of recreational interest in the protected area are the flooded quarry, reservoir on the Tarzanka river and forest. In the summertime the shores of reservoirs serve as resting places for numerous townspeople. High landscape expressiveness of the landscape is noted, due to significant excess, for the presence of natural and regulated watercourses, artificial reservoirs, frequent alternation of open and closed spaces, numerous viewpoints. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area: (a) all types of felling of forest stand; (b) procurement of mushrooms and wild growing plants containing narcotic substances; (c) use of toxic substances for forest protection; (d) agricultural activities, except for haymaking and apiculture; (e) procurement and harvesting of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources; (f) construction not related to the functioning of protected area; (g) tree tapping; (h) passage and parking of vehicles; (i) making fires outside specially equipped areas; (j) placement of cattle burial grounds, disposal sites for domestic and non-domestic waste and radioactive, chemical, explosive, toxic and poisonous substances; (k) hunting and hunting management; (l) exploration, mining and blasting operations; and (m) destruction and damaging of notices and other information signs, as well as of equipped resting places.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento a la Ley que crea el Sistema de Banca para el Desarrollo (SBD),  que debe sustentar su gestión en estrategias y acciones viables y sostenibles de inclusión financiera, económica, de acceso a mecanismos financieros y no financieros para diferentes sectores productivos. El SBD tendrá, entre otros, los siguientes objetivos: a) establecer las políticas y las acciones pertinentes que contribuyan con la inclusión financiera y económica; b) instituir las políticas crediticias aplicables que promuevan el desarrollo, la productividad y la competitividad de los sectores productivos, según el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo y las políticas públicas que se emitan al respecto; c) financiar proyectos productivos viables mediante la implementación de mecanismos crediticios, avales, garantías y servicios no financieros y de desarrollo empresarial; y d) establecer condiciones financieras de acuerdo con las características específicas, así como los requerimientos del proyecto y la actividad productiva que se apoye.

Policy: Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement (Amendment) Ordinance, 2015 (No. 4 of 2015)
Policy_Content: This Ordinance amends the Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement Act, 2013 by adding a new Chapter  IIIa, which concerns the non-application of Chapter II and III to certain projects.  The appropriate Government may, in the public interest, by notification, exempt any of the following projects from the application of the provisions of Chapter II and Chapter III of this Act, namely:— (a) such projects vital to national security or defence of India and every part thereof, including preparation for defence or defence production; (b) rural infrastructure including electrification; (c) affordable housing and housing for the poor people; (d) industrial corridors set up by the appropriate Government and its undertakings (in which case the land shall be acquired up to one kilometre on both sides of designated railway line or roads for such industrial corridor); and (e) infrastructure projects including projects under public-private partnership where the ownership of land continues to vest with the Government: Provided that the appropriate Government shall, before the issue of notification, ensure the extent of land for the proposed acquisition keeping in view the bare minimum land required for such project. The appropriate Government shall undertake a survey of its wasteland including arid land and maintain a record containing details of such land, in such manner as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government. In section 24 a proviso is added: “Provided further that in computing the period referred to in this sub-section, any period or periods during which the proceedings for acquisition of the land were held up on account of any stay or injunction issued by any court or the period specified in the award of a tribunal for taking possession or such period where possession has been taken but the compensation lying deposited in a court or in any designated account maintained for this purpose shall be excluded.”.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ordonnance n°2015-016-P-RM  du 2 avril 2015 portant création de l’Agence d’aménagement des terres et de fourniture de l’eau d’irrigation (ATI).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance crée l’Agence d’aménagement des Terres et de fourniture de l’eau d’Irrigation (ATI) dont la mission est de contribuer à la satisfaction des besoins en terres agricoles aménagées, d’appuyer la réalisation des infrastructures et équipements ruraux dans les bassins de production et d’accompagner les producteurs dans la gestion des aménagements hydro agricoles. A cet effet, elle est chargée de mener des opérations d’aménagement de terres et de création d’infrastructures de maîtrise de l’eau; de réaliser des opérations d’aménagements pastoraux et aquacoles et de création d’infrastructures et d’équipements nécessaires à leur exploitation durable; d’installer les exploitants agricoles (exploitations agricoles familiales, entreprises agricoles) sur les différents aménagements; d’accompagner les démarches de sécurisation foncière et appuyer le processus de délivrance de baux dans les grands bassins d’irrigation; d’appuyer les services techniques et les offices dans la mise en œuvre des programmes nationaux d’aménagement, de gestion des périmètres irrigués; d’accompagner les producteurs dans la gestion et la maintenance des infrastructures et équipements ruraux réalisés.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 178 validating the State Complex Program of the development of ecological education for the period up to 2020.
Policy_Content: The state integrated program for the development of ecological education of the population of the Republic of Tajikistan for the period up to 2020 is a system of priority goals, objectives and principles that form the basis of the state policy of the Republic of Tajikistan in the field of ecological education and awareness, which determines the main directions of its implementation and the formation of the ecological culture of the society. The program is aimed at developing a system of continuous ecological education and upbringing of the population. It provides for the creation of conditions for the education of a person who is aware of the importance of environmental problems and has the knowledge, skills and abilities required for the environmentally competent solution of the tasks of the socio-economic development of the country. The Program determines the long-term goals, objectives, priorities for its implementation. It serves as the basis for constructive interaction of state authorities, local governments of towns and villages, educational, cultural, environmental protection, scientific institutions of all types and levels, commercial organizations and public associations in the field of environmental education. This document is social in nature and is designed to help regulate the legal, economic and organizational framework in the field of ecological education and awareness. The objectives of this Program are: (a) the development of methodological and scientific-methodological foundations for the formation of a new vision and a new way of life of a person and society, consistent with the modern laws of the development of nature and society; (b) creation and development of a system of continuous ecological education and upbringing based on fundamental, national and universal human values, the harmonious development of nature, man and society; (c) identification and development of priority areas for the development of continuous ecological education and awareness in the changing socio-economic conditions of society. The main principles of the Program are: (a) the humanistic principle of ecological education is based on the human right to a favorable living environment, expresses the idea of forming a person with a new type of thinking, capable of environmentally sound activities, with an attitude to save life on Earth, save humanity from environmental disasters; (b) the guarantee of the acquisition by every citizen of general ecological knowledge; (c) compulsory environmental knowledge in the system of ecological education; (d) the inclusion of issues of ecological education in targeted, state, sectoral and local programs; (e) participation of citizens at all stages of decision-making on the implementation of any projects affecting the use of natural resources, as well as potentially affecting the environment and public health; (f) the priority of ecological education as a humanitarian and socially natural component of general and vocational education; (g) the universality of ecological education and upbringing; (h) ensuring the upbringing and education of all social and age groups of the population; and (i) continuity of ecological education.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Landholding Control Act, 2015 (No. 2 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns control of holding of interests in land in Montserrat by foreigners, i.e. persons other than a person belonging to Montserrat (as defined in section 2(2)(b) of the Immigration Act). Subject to the provisions of this Act, neither land in Montserrat nor a mortgage on land in Montserrat shall, be held by a person not belonging to Montserrat, and any land or mortgage so held shall be forfeited to Her Majesty. Land may be acquired, however, be acquired and held by a person not belonging to Montserrat under a lease for a term of five years or an annual tenancy or for any less interest for the purposes of residence, trade, or business, but such person shall not so hold more than five acres of land in all. The Governor acting on the advice of Cabinet may, from time to time, grant to any person not belonging to Montserrat a licence in Form A of the Schedule to hold land as owner or tenant or mortgagee of any estate or interest therein, which may subject to conditions. On breach of any condition in a licence granted under the provisions of this Act, the estate and interest of the person not belonging to Montserrat in the land or mortgage held under the authority thereof shall be forfeited to Her Majesty. The Act also concerns registration of transactions in land made under this Act and  holding property in trust for persons not belonging to Montserrat by persons belonging to Montserrat.

Policy: Ley Nº 13/2015 - Ley de ordenación territorial y urbanística de la Región de Murcia.

Policy: Order No. A-138 of the Minister of Nature, Environment and Tourism validating the “Methodology of technical and biological reclamation of disturbed lands due to mining”.
Policy_Content: This Methodology of technical and biological reclamation of disturbed lands due to mining establishes a set of measures aimed at restoring the value of the disturbed land, improving productivity, and environmental conditions of land area for the benefit of the community. It envisages arrangements for land reclamation, soil improvement and biological rehabilitation of disturbed land. The objective of rehabilitation of land disturbed by open pit mining shall be to restore agricultural land for subsequent use for agricultural production, pastures, haymaking and crop production. The objective rehabilitation of forested areas shall be afforestation with a view of planting forest nurseries for plant production of forest species. The objective of rehabilitation of waterbodies shall be to restore water abstraction for households and industrial water uses, irrigation, recreational water uses and fishfarming. This Methodology sets forth maximum permissible soil pollution levels, in particular by hazardous and toxic substances. For the purpose of increasing the fertility of land area destined for rehabilitation and soil improvement shall be taken into account the proposed reclamation area and the following activities will be considered: (a) essential requirements for soil improvement in the rehabilitation area; (b) preparation of land area destined for rehabilitation; (c) the amount of topsoil stocked to be used for rehabilitation; (d) characteristics of fertile soil layer; (e) material and its availability for soil improvement; and (f) the future use of the rehabilitated area and the environmental, social and economic benefits.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources

Policy: Decree-Law No. 43/2015 amending Decree-Law No. 102/2010 on air quality assessment and management.

Amendments deal with: levels above which short-term exposure poses risks to human health in particular to sensitive groups in the population from which immediate disclosure of adequate information is required; networks and private air quality monitoring stations, whose placement is required in compliance with the conditions imposed under the licensing of an associated installation, shall carry out the measurements respecting all the requirements and air quality standards. Zones and agglomerations where the levels of one or more pollutants exceed the limits of tolerance, or the target value shall establish integrated air quality plans which cover all related pollutants, including appropriate measures to ensure that the period of exceeding is as short as possible and specific measures to protect sensitive population groups, in particular children is established.

Policy: Modern Slavery Act 2015 (Cap. 30).
Policy_Content: This Act prohibits holding of persons in slavery or servitude or to force a person to perform forced or compulsory labour and the circumstances are such that the person knows or ought to know that the other person is being required to perform forced or compulsory labour. The Act consists of 62 sections divided in seven Parts. Part 1 consolidates and clarifies the existing offences of slavery and human trafficking whilst increasing the maximum penalty for such offences. Part 2 provides for two new civil preventative orders, the Slavery and Trafficking Prevention Order and the Slavery and Trafficking Risk Order. Part 3 provides for new maritime enforcement powers in relation to ships. Part 4 establishes the office of Independent Antislavery Commissioner and sets out the functions of the Commissioner. Part 5 introduces a number of measures focussed on supporting and protecting victims, including a statutory defence for slavery or trafficking victims and special measures for witnesses in criminal proceedings. Part 6 requires certain businesses to disclose what activity they are undertaking to eliminate slavery and trafficking from their supply chains and their own business. Part 7 requires the Secretary of State to publish a paper on the role of the Gangmasters Licensing Authority and otherwise relates to general matters such as consequential provision and commencement. The Act is completed by 5 Schedules. A ship may be seized and forfeited.

Policy: Ley Nº 8 - Crea el Ministerio de Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Ministerio de Ambiente, como entidad rectora del Estado en materia de protección, conservación y restauración del ambiente y el uso sostenible de los recursos naturales para asegurar el cumplimiento y aplicación de la leyes, los reglamentos y la Política Nacional de Ambiente. El Ministerio de Ambiente deberá convocar a consulta pública sobre temas o problemas ambientales que, por su importancia, requieran ser sometidos a la consideración de la población. Las instituciones públicas sectoriales con competencia ambiental conformarán el Sistema Interinstitucional de Ambiente y estarán obligadas a establecer mecanismos de coordinación, consulta y ejecución entre sí, siguiendo los parámetros del Ministerio de Ambiente que rigen el Sistema, con el fin de armonizar sus políticas, evitar conflictos o vacíos de competencia y responder, con eficiencia y coherencia, a los objetivos y fines de la presente Ley y a los lineamientos de la Política Nacional de Ambiente. A nivel local, los directores regionales del Ministerio de Ambiente podrán conformar plataformas de coordinación interinstitucional con el fin de coordinar acciones técnicas, científicas y administrativas entre las instituciones públicas, para el aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos y conservación de ecosistemas, propiciando el ordenamiento de las actividades humanas.

Policy: Decree No. 171 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Procedure for conducting special control of persons applying for positions that involve holding a responsible or particularly responsible position and positions with high corruption risk.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the Procedure for conducting special control of persons applying for positions that involve holding a responsible or particularly responsible position and positions with high corruption risk. A special control shall be carried out on persons applying for positions that involve holding a responsible or particularly responsible position, and positions with increased corruption risk (except for cases envisaged by law), including Information and data submitted in person. It lists the official positions subject to control for the purpose of corruption risk assessment. The following information and data shall be subject to mandatory special control: (a) existence of a court decision that has entered into force, according to which the person was prosecuted, including for corruption offence, as well as the presence of a criminal record, its removal, cancellation; (b) the person was charged with and convicted of administrative corruption-related offences; (c) the accuracy of the information specified in the declaration of the person Authorized to perform the functions of the state or local self-government; (d) attribution to a person of corporate rights;  5) state of health (in terms of the person's registration at psychoneurological or narcological health care institutions), education, availability of a scientific degree, academic title; (e) military service status; (f) access to state secrets required in accordance with the qualification requirements for a particular position; and (g) applicability to a person of prohibition to hold relevant position in accordance with the Law of Ukraine “On civil servant screening”.

Policy_Content: This By-law of the city of Cape Town concerns spatial development of the city area and regulates development matters such as water infrastructure, stormwater management, environmental protection, subdivisions of land and zoning. It also requires the city council to establish a Planning Tribunal for its municipal area. The City may, when approving an application for subdivision, require the applicant to establish an owners’ association for an area determined in the conditions of approval. If the City considers it necessary, a stormwater impact assessment and/or stormwater management plan may be required in conjunction with a site development plan, the extent of which shall be determined by the City depending on the magnitude of the development. Zoning can be for agricultural or environment protection purposes (this can be "overlay zoning" for specific management mechanisms).

Policy: Emissions Performance Standard Regulations 2015  (S.I. No. 933 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations concern emission limits as defined in Chapter 8 of Part 2 of the Energy Act 2013. That Chapter imposes a duty (emissions limit duty) on operators of fossil fuel plant granted planning consent on or after 18th February 2014, to ensure that its annual emissions of carbon dioxide attributable to fossil fuels do not exceed an amount ("the emissions limit”) determined according to a formula set out in section 57(2) of the Act. The Regulations, among other things: define the application of emission limits; provide for modification of the emissions limit where particular conditions apply during a year; exempt from the emissions limit certain duty generating units; set out which emissions are relevant in determining whether a fossil fuel plant has breached the emissions limit duty.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 310-p validating the Regulation on access to protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree classifies regional protected areas as natural complexes and objects of nature protection, scientific research, cultural, aesthetic, recreational and healthcare significance. It regulates public access to protected areas of regional and local significance, including natural parks, state nature reserves and nature monuments. Access to protected areas shall be granted for the following purposes: (a) excursion activities, tourism and sport; (b) scientific research; (b) collection of mineralogical, zoological and other species; (c) harvesting and picking of wild fauna, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (d) compilation of herbal and biological collections; and (e) hunting and capture of wild fauna species for scientific research and regulation of the number of wild fauna species.

Policy: Regulation of the Ministry of Environment and Forestry of the R.I. No. P.12/Menlhk-II/2015 on the Development of Industrial Plantation Forests.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Regulation, consisting of 25 articles divided into eleven Chapters, implements Government Regulation No. 6 of 2007 on Forest Management and Preparation of Forest Management Plan and Forest Use, and establishes the Development of Industrial Plantation Forests. Business License for Timber Forest Products Use in an industrial timber estate in forestry production (IUPHHK-HTI, formerly known as HPHT or HPHTI), is a business license granted to use forest products in the form of timber in plantations in production forests through land preparation, seeding, planting, maintenance, harvesting, and marketing. Industrial Plantation Forest Development is intended to increase the productivity of production forests, optimize the utilization of Industrial Plantation Forest space, and improve the competitiveness of production of plantation products. Industrial Plantation Forest Development aims to meet the sustainability of forestry industry raw materials, increase production and diversification of forest products, improve environmental aspects and community empowerment around production forests in plantations. The scope of this Ministerial Regulation includes: a. Area requirement in IUPHHK-HTI; b. IUPHHK-HTI land-use planning; c. Silvicultural system; d. Plant type and cropping pattern; e. Research and technology development and provision of superior seeds; f. Manage Social and Environment.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regulation No. 233 on protection of Gardlaushøgda natural reserve, Bærum  municipality, Akershus.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to preserve a rich wooded area of approx. 575 acres with endangered, rare and vulnerable species. The area has touches of tall-herb spruce, lime forests and deposits of scree, old coniferous and deciduous forests with multiple habitats. The aim of these regulations is to preserve the particular biodiversity habitat, ecosystem and pland/animal species characteristics. Gard Laus Høgda is a distinctive zone with many types of vegetation and tree species consisting of coniferous forest with significant deposits of pine of relatively large dimensions of rich vascular plant flora, boreal deciduous woods and rich deciduous forest. Calcareous forests, rich hazel thicket, elm-linden forests and rich swamp forests are represented in this zone.

Policy: Order No. 237 of the Minister of the National Economy validating “Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the establishment of sanitary protection zone of industrial facilities”.
Policy_Content: “Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the establishment of sanitary protection zone of industrial facilities” determine the requirements for the selection of land, design, construction, reconstruction, repair and commissioning of production facilities, which are sources of impact on the environment and human health, as well as requirements for hazard class of production facilities, design requirements and the size of sanitary protection zone, sanitary breaks, the grounds for revising these dimensions, methods and order of their establishment, planting of greenery and restriction on the use of the territory of sanitary protection zone. Sources of impact on the environment and human health are objects for which the levels of pollution generated outside the industrial site exceed 0.1 maximum permissible concentration (MPC) and/or maximum permissible level (MPL) or contribution to the pollution of residential area exceeds 0.1 MPC. The objective of sanitary protection area shall be to apply measures for the protection of the population against emissions of hazardous chemical substances to the atmosphere. When operating the facility, calculations of expected air pollution and levels of physical impact should be verified by the results of field studies and measurements. The dimensions of the sanitary protection zone for production facilities that are sources of physical factors affecting the population are established on the basis of acoustic calculations taking into account the location of the sources and the nature of the noise, vibration and non-ionizing radiation they generate. To establish the size of sanitary protection zone, the design parameters are confirmed by field measurements of the factors of physical impact on the atmospheric air during the operation of the facility during the year after reaching the design capacity. Sanitary protection zone must include landscape-recreational areas.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Public health,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Hazardous substances,Noise pollution,Pollution control,Pesticides
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 237 of 20 March 2015 validating the Sanitary regulations "Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the establishment of a sanitary protection zone of industrial facilities".
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree provides sanitary classification of industrial facilities establishing 5 classes of hazard and the length of sanitary protection zone for each class. Facilities for production of pesticides, synthetic chemical and pharmaceutical products, large swine, cattle, poultry and meat production facilities are listed as industrial facilities of hazard class 1.  Facilities for antibiotics production fall within hazard class 2. In particular, this Ministerial Decree refers to processing of non-edible products of animal origin, recycling of fallen animals and dead fishes, processing of foodstuffs and food additives. Business entities classified as hazardous are considered to be sources of impact on environment and public health if exceed maximum allowable limit of concentration of pollutants by 0, 1. Sanitary protection zones shall be established with a view of ensuring safety of the population and reduction of air pollution.

Policy: Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 810 of 2015).
Policy_Content: The Regulations apply in England and in specified marine waters and the seabed. They specify the types of damage to a protected species or natural habitat, a site of special scientific interest, water or land which constitute “environmental damage” for the purposes of the Regulations and the types of activity causing environmental damage to which the Regulations apply. There are certain exemptions and exclusions from the application of the Regulations. The Regulations also specify the authorities whose function it is to enforce the Regulations. Policy: Law No. 7.454 establishing procedures, prohibitions, rules and precautions for the use of fires in farming, silvo-pastoralism and forestry practices.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of five Chapters, establishes procedures, prohibitions, rules and precautions for the use of fires in farming, silvo-pastoralism and forestry practices. It specifies that from 1 July 2014 it is prohibited the use of fires even in the form of controlled fires for the purpose of burning plants or any other form of vegetation, contained in a range of thousand metres from urban areas of any size, delimited from urbanized area, or five hundred metres from urban limits, if larger. Controlled fires require strict authorization, issued by the Institute of the Environment - IMA, the Organ of the National Environmental System - SISNAMA or, depending on the State region, prior authorization provided by agency or institution officially designated by the Institute of Environment - IMA. The Law is divided as follows: Fires prohibition (Chap. I); Fires authorisation (Chap. II); Planning and Temporary Suspension of Fires Authorisation (Chap. III); Gradual Reduction as Fires Clearing Method of Sugar Cane Cutting (Chap. IV); Final provisions (Chap. V).

Policy: Regional Decree No. 101-PP/Z “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Part II of the Antarctic Act 2013 made a number of minor changes to the permit regime set out in the Antarctic Act 1994. The changes bring non-UK nationals on British expeditions into the scope of the permit regime; allows the UK to permit conservation work on historic sites and monuments in Antarctica; and creates new offences of introducing non-sterile soil or microscopic organisms into Antarctica, damaging native invertebrates, or having an animal on board a vessel.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 7 - Metodología para las cesiones y compensaciones del Fondo de Estabilización para el fomento de la exportación de carne leche y sus derivados.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo establece la metodología para las cesiones y compensaciones del Fondo de Estabilización para el fomento de la exportación de carne leche y sus derivados. En cumplimiento de sus objetivos, el Fondo de Estabilización realizará las siguientes operaciones de estabilización: a) Operación de Compensación de Estabilización, entendida como los pagos que se otorgarán a los productores ganaderos, vendedores y exportadores de los productos cuyos mercados se pretende estabilizar, por sus ventas en los mercados objeto de las operaciones de estabilización, cuando el indicador de precio para dichos mercados sea inferior al indicador de precio de referencia calculado para las operaciones de estabilización; b) Operación de Cesión de Estabilización, entendida como los pagos que recibirá el Fondo por parte del productor ganadero, vendedor o exportador de los productos cuyos mercados se pretende estabilizar, por sus ventas en los mercados objeto de las operaciones de estabilización, cuando el indicador de precio para dichos mercados sea superior al indicador de precio de referencia calculado para las operaciones de estabilización.

Policy: Kitui County Villages Act, 2015 (No. 1 of 2014).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes villages in Kitui County and provides with respect to their administration. The object and purpose of this Act is to provide for the further decentralization of the functions and provision of services by the Kitui County Government in accordance with Article 176(2) of the Constitution. Villages are established for proper coordination and facilitation of citizen participation in the development of policies and plans and delivery of services. Each village unit shall be administered by a Village Administrator in accordance with the provisions of Section 52 of the County Governments Act, 2012. A Village Administrator shall coordinate, manage and supervise the general administrative functions in the village including- (a) Pursuant to Paragraph 14 of Part II of the Fourth Schedule to the Constitution- (i) Ensuring and co-ordinating the participation of the village unit in governance; and (ii) Assisting the village unit to develop administrative capacity for the effective exercise of the functions and powers and participation in governance at the local level.  In each village unit a village council shall be established in accordance with Section 53 of the County Governments Act, 2012.  The Village councils shall be responsible for the following:- (1) co-ordinating and ensuring citizen participation in the county governance; (2) assisting respective village to develop administrative capacity for the effective exercise of function and powers; (3) monitoring the implementation of policies and programs at the village level; (4) advising the Ward Administrator and Sub-County Administrator on the matters pertaining to the Village; and (5) any other function necessary for the better administration of the Village.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Concretamente, se autoriza a los Gobiernos Autónomos, al Ministerio de Desarrollo Rural y Tierras y al Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y Agua, realizar la contratación directa de bienes, obras y/o servicios generales hasta el monto máximo indicado, de aquellos proveedores que realicen las actividades establecidas en el artículo 8 del Código de Comercio. Entre las actividades previas a la contratación se contempla la elaboración de las especificaciones técnicas, estimar el precio referencial, emitir certificación presupuestaria y autorizar el inicio del proceso de contratación.

Policy: Planning (Hazardous Substances) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 627 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement the land-use planning obligations (articles 13 and 15) in Directive 2012/18/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control of major-accident hazards involving dangerous substances. The non-planning aspects of the Directive are implemented through The Control of Major Accident Hazards Regulations 2015. The Regulations, among other things: set out the substances which are hazardous substances for the purposes of the Planning (Hazardous Substances) Act 1990, the controlled quantities of those substances, and exemptions from the need for hazardous substances consent; define  procedures for the enforcement of hazardous substances control; set out the information to be held in a consents register; specify obligations to take certain matters in the Directive into account in land use planning policies and other relevant policies, and public consultation and participation obligations in relation to certain plans, programmes and projects where the presence of hazardous substances is relevant.

Policy: Law No. 1190 “On oil and gas”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, economic, organizational framework and state policy in the field of oil and gas and aims to develop this industry in the Republic of Tajikistan. It covers the activities of natural persons and legal entities related to the projecting, prospecting, exploration, extraction, processing, transportation, storage, and provision of emergency and rescue services, including government control on security in the oil and gas industry. Oil and gas fields are the exclusive property of the state. The extracted oil and gas in accordance with the terms and conditions may be the property of legal entities, including the joint property of foreign natural persons and legal entities. Competence of the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan in the oil and gas industry shall be as follows: (a) definition of a unified state policy in the oil and gas industry; (b) approval of regulatory legal acts in the field of projecting, prospecting, exploration, extraction, processing, transportation, storage and turnover of oil and gas products; (c) appointment of the authorized state body in the oil and gas industry; (d) creation of the national reserve fund of oil and gas fields; (e) approval of the composition of the commission and regulations on the procedure for holding tenders for the provision of the right to use promising areas with oil and gas fields; (f) approval of the rules for using state-owned geological and geophysical data for educational, scientific, commercial purposes and their export outside the Republic of Tajikistan for further research; (g) establishing the procedure for making oil and gas reserves in the state balance and excluding them from the state balance; (h) approval of the pipeline construction line; and (i) implementation of another competence not prohibited by the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan. Management of oil and gas fields shall be regulated by contracts. This Law consists of 6 Chapters divided into 20 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards state regulation in oil and gas sector. Chapter 3 establishes the procedure for prospecting of oil and gas deposits. Chapter 4 deals with main pipelines and transportation of oil and gas. Chapter 5 regards safety of oil and gas mining facilities and transportation system. Chapter 6 lays down final provisions.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No.78 of 2015 issuing the Executive Regulations of Law No.116 of 2014 regarding Public Private Partnerships.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consists of 76 articles. It establishes that the procurement and implementation of a PPP Project may be submitted by (i) Public Entities; (ii) the Higher Committee; and (iii) the private sector. The Authority shall establish a Competition Committee for each PPP Project with the following tasks: review, complete and prepare project related studies, instruments and procurement documents; evaluate the technical and financial offers; and supervise the public session set for opening the financial envelopes of the technically accepted offers. A proposed project must be accompanied by a feasibility study, whose criteria are set out in art.7, which is developed in two phases (1) an initial feasibility study containing a preliminary analysis of the comprehensive feasibility study components; and (2) a comprehensive feasibility study that particularly determines the technical and operational aspects of the Concept for the implementation of a project, as well as its economic aspect.

The Geology and Mines Laboratory (LGM), in line with the national strategy for geological resources and the strategy for green growth aims at: a) implementing public policies in conjunction with other bodies, namely the Directorate-General for Energy and Geology (DGEG); b) ensuring the functions of the State in the development of the geo-scientific knowledge of the geological infrastructure of the national territory, including the coastal zones, the continental shelf and deep water zones; c) promoting geological survey, study and preservation of the geological resources; d) promoting studies for research and application of geological knowledge in the fields of geological risks, location of large infrastructures, geothermal energy, geological storage, namely of CO2 and geological heritage, including related technical activities, etc.

Policy: Order No. 5n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Botanical Garden-Institute of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Botanical Garden-Institute of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance, defines tasks, scientific profile, the particulars of legal status, organizational structure, applicable special protection regime as protected natural area of federal significance. Botanical Garden-Institute of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences is located in Vladivostok and is inserted in the State Register of Protected Areas of the Primorie region. Scientific profile of the Botanical Garden-Institute of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences is botanical. The main purpose of the Botanical Garden-Institute of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be performance of fundamental research and applied developments in the field of botany, ecology, forestry, nature protection. The main tasks of the Arboretum Parks shall be as follows: (a) study of adaptive strategies, phytocenotic, ecological and chorological features of the vegetation cover of the Far East; (b) development of theoretical foundations and methods for preserving plant gene pool; (c) introduction of rare and economically valuable plant species in botanical gardens of the Far East; (d) development of effective methods for the introduction and selection of decorative plants in the climate of southern Primorie; (e) creation of special collections of plants in order to preserve biodiversity and enrichment of flora, preservation of natural environment and natural landscapes, preservation of a unique forest area black fir-deciduous forests; (f) development of methods for environmental education; (g) popularization and propaganda of bioecological knowledge; (h) promoting the development of dendrolandscape and phytodesigner culture, medicinal and other plant growing in the region; (i) preservation in artificial conditions of collections of living plants (especially rare and endangered species) and other botanical species of great scientific, educational, economic and cultural value; (j)  research; and (k) conducting educational, pedagogical and scientific work in the fields of botany and nature protection, plant growing and selection, decorative gardening and landscape architecture.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 120 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure, to ensure availability and conservation of landmarks. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate. Policy: Order No. 251 on subsidy for the establishment of farrowing units.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations concerning the grant of subsidy for the investment in sustainable housing facilities for farrowing pens.  The Danish AgriFish Agency regulates this Order and is authorized to grant subsidy for projects related to the conversion of these buildings. Approval of subsidy grants shall be given to agricultural farmers primarily working at least 830 working hours in this sector. The Agency shall publish criteria for applying online and applications should be submitted from 19 March and received by the Agency no later than 19 May 2015. Criteria for granting subsidy is based on the approval from public authorities and for an eligibility of min. 300 000 DKK. The farrowing pens in the housing unit must be of 5-10 square meters, with a stable system expandable to a maximum of 1 500 cubic meters. The project should be accessible for supervisory and inspection purposes. Additionally, eligible project costs may include costs for equipment associated with the rebuilding or new construction; and for architectural, engineering and other professional services’ fees implemented during the project. It is NOT permitted to grant subsidies to projects receiving other EU funding, for the purchase or leasing of equipment, and for expenditures in adherence to article 69 of Council Regulation No. 1303/2013. Decisions taken by the Agency may be appealed through the AgriFish Appeal centre.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Order No. 250 on investment subsidies for new green processes and technologies in agricultural production.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Order is to grant financial support to farmers for their investment in processes and technologies in agriculture production. Its aim is to reduce environmental and climate pollution through: the reduction of emissions of greenhouse gases and ammonia from livestock and manure; reduction of pesticide use; reduction in loss of nutrients during feeding, digestion in manure application; reduction of energy, water, nutrients or pesticides in horticulture; establishment of environmentally friendly production to reduce emissions from meat sector (pork and beef). For each of these actions, the Danish AgriFish Agency regulates this Order and updates a list of proven effective technologies applied (accessible online). Appendix 1 lists the calculated time rate applied to farmer’s agricultural activities – necessary to apply for the subsidy requirement. Criteria for obtaining subsidies is based on public authority approval of procedures and completion date of projects aiming to the reduction of pesticide use, retention of nutrients from the soil, scraping systems for the cleaning of floors in livestock air purification/ventilation systems. The criteria for grant of subsidy extends to projects or parts thereof covered by EU procurement rules treaty and with an eligibility of max. DKK 300 000. Chapter 11 sets regulations regarding decisions made by the Danish AfriFish Agency, which may be appealed to the Ministry of Food Complaint Center.

The systematization of data of state accounting of water use shall be performed for the following purposes: (a) current and future planning of water resources use and implementation of water protection measures; (b) distribution of productive forces on the national territory; (c) drawing up schemes of integrated use and protection of water resources and water balance; (d) projecting of sites related to the use of water resources; (e) forecasting changes in hydrological conditions, water level in the rivers and water quality; (f) development of measures to improve the efficiency of water management systems; (g) assessment of water consumption and drainage, as well as indicators of water quality; (h) development of measures to prevent hazardous impact on water and elimination of the negative consequences thereof; (i) implementation of state supervision (control) in the field of protection and rational management of water and reproduction of water resources;  (j) regulation of the relationship among water users, as well as between water users and other enterprises, institutions and organizations; and (k) examination issues related to the registration and use of water. State Water Resources Agency shall be the authorized state institution in the sphere of accounting and registration of water resources.

Policy: Egypt’s Five Year Macroeconomic Framework and Strategy 2014/15 – 2018/19.
Policy_Content: To describe the framework for Egypt’s medium term economic vision and outline the concrete policies, programs and projects that will guide and operationalize the growth strategy, Egypt prepared this Five-year Macroeconomic Framework and Strategy to be implemented within the 2019. The government’s vision aims at creating a productive and efficient economy that generates high, sustainable and inclusive growth through a new reform agenda that combines pro-growth and pro-private sector policies with social protection and jobs-focused priorities. The broad targets to achieve are: (i) sustainable real GDP growth reaching at least 6% by the end of the period; (ii) a faster pace of job creation in order to bring the unemployment rate below 10% and in particular to address the high rate of youth unemployment; (iii) greater efficiency in government spending in parallel with a planned reduction of the fiscal deficit and the government debt; (iv) headline Inflation within a 6 - 8% range; (v) higher rates of domestic investment; (vi) improved export performance; (vii) the development of the country’s human resources supported by increased spending on health, education and Research and Development as mandated by the Constitution; (viii) enhanced productivity on the national level and continued investment in and upgrading of infrastructure, also with the partnership of the private sector (through a PPP program). The Government identifies three policy channels to achieve the objectives: 1) fiscal consolidation, 2) prudent monetary policy and 3) legislative reforms. Fiscal consolidation will narrow the deficit and reduce debt while creating room to shift resources from wasteful spending to social programs and productive sectors through making the tax regime fair, equitable and pro-growth, widening the tax base; and improving tax buoyancy. Monetary policy will seek to control and gradually reduce inflation in the medium term to improve real incomes and enhance external competitiveness, while maintaining an active and orderly foreign exchange market that reflects supply and demand. Finally, the government is committed to creating an attractive, predictable, fair and internationally competitive business environment enhancing the domestic investment environment through an active and wide-ranging process of legal and regulatory reforms.

Policy: Resolución Nº 24 - Regula la actividad de autogeneración a gran escala en el Sistema Interconectado Nacional (SIN).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución regula la actividad de autogeneración a gran escala que se encuentra conectado al Sistema Interconectado Nacional (SIN). Un autogenerador tiene la categoría de gran escala si la potencia máxima supera el límite para los autogeneradores a pequeña escala establecido por la Unidad de Planeación Minero Energética (UPME). El autogenerador estará obligado a suscribir un contrato de respaldo con el operador de red o transportador al cual se conecte, acorde con las condiciones de la conexión. El operador de red o el transportador deberán prestar el servicio de respaldo a los autogeneradores cuyas plantas se encuentren ubicadas en su mercado, cuando estos lo requieran.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 132-pP “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate. Policy: National Plan of Action for the Conservation and Management of Sharks on the High Seas.
Policy_Content: The National Plan of Action for the Conservation and Management of Sharks on the High Seas is a national policy with a sectoral approach. The overall purpose of this policy is to ensure the conservation and management of sharks and their sustainable use on the high seas and in the Exclusive Economic Zone under the responsibility of the Belize Fisheries Department. The main objectives of this policy are: (I) sustainable shark catches from directed and non-directed fisheries, (II) special attention to vulnerable shark stocks, (III) minimization of waste and discards from shark catches, (IV) optimal use of dead sharks, (V) the documentation/categorization and reporting of species-specific catch and landing data and monitoring of shark catches through bilateral cooperation between States, (VI) strengthened cooperation with regional and sub-regional fisheries organizations with the aim of ensuring the sustainability of shark stocks, (VII) strengthened cooperation with other States to strive to ensure effective conservation and management of transboundary, straddling, highly migratory and high seas stocks of sharks and data sharing, (VIII) collaboration in research, training and the production of information and educational material through FAO and the major RFMOs and other international arrangements, and (IX) implementation of measures, such as national inspection programs and observer coverage for vessels that target shark exclusively so as to ensure proper monitoring, data collection and recording.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 55-p “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Guinea Bissau 2025 - Strategic and Operational Plan 2015-2020 “Terra Ranka”.
Policy_Content: The Strategic and Operational Plan 2015-2020 “Terra Ranka” Guinea-Bissau's Vision 2025 indicates the future destination and the 2015-2020 operational plan of its major axes (the strategic orientations). To fully develop the drivers of growth, the fundamentals of competitiveness must be in place. For example, fishing cannot develop without the sustainable management of fishery resources to ensure species renewal. Guinea Bissau has five foundations that will be needed to build the Guinea Bissau 2025 and that converge towards a sustainable and supportive development. The five other strategic axes are: peace and governance; biodiversity and natural capital (aiming to sustainably preserve and enhance the country's natural resources); infrastructure and urban development (aimed at providing the country with the logistical, energy, digital and urban infrastructures necessary for its development); human development (aiming to enhance the potentiality of the Guinean population); and simplification of the Business Sector and Development of the Private Sector (aiming to implement an enabling the private sector).

Policy: Regulation No. 218 date 11.2.2015 on the criteria and rules of procedure of exploiting land areas adjacent to existing permits and changing the boundaries of mineral permits defined in space with three coordinates.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down criteria and rules of procedure for exploiting above and under surface areas that are adjacent to existing permits, and changing the boundaries of mineral permits defined in space with three coordinates. The Regulation acknowledges the right of licensed operators to apply for additional exploitation areas adjacent to the boundaries of their existing permits if they have approached the end of reserves in their permitted areas, or have expressed special interest in improving technological and production indicators, or there is need for capital works that will also result in expansion of the mine depth. Under no circumstances will the newly proposed area be larger than the existing permit area. The National Agency of Natural Resources examines the technical and economic project proposals and reaches a decision within 45 days of application. Further, the entities that possess mineral permits where boundaries are defined with three coordinates may request a change in the coordinates of their permitted exploitation area. This Regulation does not apply for mining rights granted through concession agreements. Regarding governance the Ministry of Energy and Industry, the Ministry of Environment, the National Agency of Natural Resources, and the National Center for Licensing are responsible for the regulation implementation.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Amiri Decree No.6 of 2015 reorganizing the Administrative Control and Transparency Authority (ACTA).
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 21 articles aims at reorganizing the Administrative Control and Transparency Authority (ACTA) established by the Amiri Decree No.75 of 2011. Purpose of the Authority is to (i) contribute to achieving the highest indicators of integrity and transparency in the field of public service; and (ii) work to combat corruption in all its forms and forms. To achieve the goals the Authority undertakes, among others, the following tasks (i) work to implement the obligations resulting from its ratification of the United Nations Convention against Corruption; (ii) develop a national strategy to enhance integrity and transparency; (iii) research and study the causes of deficiencies in the administrative, technical and financial systems that impede the regular functioning of the bodies subject to the Authority’s control; (iv) propose means and procedures to enhance integrity and transparency in managing state property, proposing clear standards for transparency in  bid procedures, and preparing an integrity charter for public employees, contractors and suppliers; (v) disseminate knowledge related to integrity and transparency, facilitate  access by individuals to it; (vi) provide communication channels with the public, to receive their suggestions and complaints regarding corrupt and unfair behavior; (vii) cooperate with regional and international bodies, organizations and associations concerned with combating corruption, exchanging knowledge and participating in meetings; (viii) study what the media publish in terms of complaints or investigations dealing with aspects of negligence, deficiencies, mismanagement; (ix) propose the necessary legislation to prevent and combat corruption, taking into account the standards and requirements stipulated in the agreement, and to undertake periodic review of these legislations to develop them. The Authority shall be managed by a President, appointed by an Emiri Decree. The powers of the President are provided for in article 8.

Policy: National Export Strategy on Tourism.
Policy_Content: This National Export Strategy on Tourism is a 5-year nationwide sectoral document developed by the Government of Liberia with the intent of diversifying the Liberian economy and harnessing the tourism based resources of the country. It  provides a detailed Plan of Action (PoA) that will facilitate growth in the sector. Through the steps outlined in the PoA, tourism stakeholders in Liberia will improve their capability to offer competitive products, improve lives, define and develop policies that governs the sector, boost the economy, strengthen the private sector, empower youth and women. The main goal will be achieved through the following six strategic objectives (i) improve the business and investment climate for the tourism sector; (ii) improve necessary infrastructure for supporting the sector; (iii) improve skills development in the sector; (iv) ensure environmental sustainability and integration of local community involvement in the development process; (v) improve institutional capacities and coordination; and (vi) improve the Liberian tourism brand, and develop robust tourism offerings.

Policy: Plan stratégique sante des adolescents et des jeunes 2015-2020
Policy_Content: Le présent Plan stratégique sante des adolescents et des jeunes 2015-2020 est un document sectoriel du Burkina Faso à portée nationale qui a pour objectif principal de réduire la mortalité et les morbidités chez les adolescents et les jeunes du Burkina Faso d’ici 2020. Les objectifs spécifiques du plan stratégique de la santé des adolescents et des jeunes sont : réduire la prévalence du VIH chez les adolescent(e)s et les jeunes de 0,30% à 0,15% et les IST de 30% à 15%; réduire le nombre de grossesses précoces et/ou non désirées chez les adolescentes et les jeunes de 20%; réduire le taux des avortements clandestins chez les adolescentes et les jeunes de 10%; réduire les niveaux de base de consommation des substances nocives (alcool, tabac, drogue...) chez les adolescent(e)s et jeunes de 10%; réduire la prévalence des maladies mentales chez les adolescent(e)s et jeunes de 30%; réduire les traumatismes (accidents de la circulation routière) de 25% chez les adolescents et les jeunes; améliorer l’offre de soins et de services de santé de qualité aux services de santé de qualité par les adolescents et jeunes; renforcer la coordination, le suivi et l’évaluation des interventions de santé des adolescents et des jeunes à tous les niveaux du système de santé; accroître la production et utilisation des données spécifiques de santé des adolescents et jeunes; accroître le financement alloué aux activités liées à la santé des adolescents et jeunes ; anémie et carences en micronutriments ; et malnutritions.

Policy: THE SEIMAS OF THE REPUBLIC OF LITHUANIA   RULING ON APPROVAL OF THE NATIONAL ANTI-CORRUPTION PROGRAM OF THE REPUBLIC OF LITHUANIA FOR 2015–2025 2015 March 10 No. XII-1537 Vilnius.
Policy_Content: National Anti-Corruption Program of the Republic of Lithuania for 2015–2025 is a nationwide multi-sectoral policy document aimed at ensuring a long-term, effective and targeted system of corruption prevention and control in the Republic of Lithuania in 2015–2025. The Program covers key provisions of national anti-corruption policies in the public and private sectors. The program focuses on the reduction and elimination of the conditions and risks of corruption, as well as the management of corruption risks and the implementation of liability for corruption offenses. Corruption is one of the national threats to the state and one of the most dangerous social phenomena, threatening human rights, democracy and the rule of law, distorting social justice, fair competition, business conditions, undermining economic growth, endangering public administration, stability of state or municipal institutions and public morale. Corruption is associated with excessive bureaucracy and regulation, a balance of discretion and accountability. Corruption is a latent phenomenon, and the impact of corrupt offenses on various economic and social spheres usually only becomes apparent later in the face of the consequences of corruption. The program has been prepared taking into account the environmental analysis, the results of sociological research, proposals submitted by public, state and municipal institutions.

Policy: Agriculture Law No.13 of 2015.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 73 articles divided in XIV Sections aims at re-organizing agriculture sector in the Kingdom of Jordan. The Ministry of Agriculture shall regulate, organize and develop the agriculture field in order to: increase the production of food and foodstuffs; use of natural and agricultural resources without damaging the environment; create of suitable conditions for investing in agricultural sectors and rural development; increase the production capacity; increase farmer’s incomes and improve their lifestyle; protect animals; improve the use of irrigation waters; face animal and plant diseases and epidemics; carry out scientific research and desertification control; and encourage agricultural cooperative work and agricultural cooperative associations. Public health measures and sanitary plant measures are discussed in articles 5-8. The Ministry of Agriculture shall: issue importation and exportation licences for agricultural products; in cooperation with other authorities, contribute in defining the National Standardization and Metrology standards for agricultural products; issue the directives required to organize plant production in a manner that secures efficiency of production and conservation of the agricultural resources and the environment. The Law establishes that licences are required for: establishing olive presses; producing, propagating, trading in seeds, fertilizers, plant growth regulators, the veterinary medicines,  bio-veterinary preparations or animal growth regulators; producing or preparing pesticides; investing private forests through pruning or replacement of forest trees with fruit trees; grazing in the governmental forests; processing, investing or transport forest materials; cutting forest trees or bushes or wild plants; processing coal from governmental or private forests; establishing farms or hatcheries; producing or preparing materials of raw feed of animal origin, manufactured feed or feed additives; operating in slaughterhouses of poultry and livestock; fishing for commercial purposes; hunting wild birds or wild animals.

Policy: Marine Living Resources Act: Regulations relating to small-scale fishing (No. 229 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations of Minister of the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries are made under section 19 of the Marine Living Resources Act, 1998 and concern development of small-scale fishing communities. They provide communities with the opportunity to register with the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries so as to be recognized as mall-scale fishing communities. The verification procedure must be conducted in order to determine whether each person of the intended small-scale fishing community, meets the criteria of a small-scale fisher as set out in these Regulations. The Department must assist small-scale fishing communities with: (a) mobilizing and registering the small-scale fishing community as a cooperative; (b) identifying suitable species to be used for commercial purposes and for own consumption by the co-operative; (c) demarcating small-scale fishing areas; (d) applying for a small-scale fishing right in accordance with the criteria referred to in these Regulations. A small-scale fishing right must only be allocated to one cooperative per small-scale fishing community that has as its membership all the verified small-scale fishers of that small-scale fishing community. To improve beneficiation to small-scale fishers and to enhance the negotiation powers of small-scale fishing communities, small-scale fishing communities shall form secondary co-operatives with other small-scale fishing communities.

Policy: Ley Nº 28.020 – Crea el Ministerio de la Mujer y de la Equidad de Género.

La Ley define la equidad de género como un principio que comprende el trato idéntico o diferenciado entre hombres y mujeres que resulta en una total ausencia de cualquier forma de discriminación arbitraria contra las mujeres por ser tales, en lo que respecta al goce y ejercicio de todos sus derechos humanos.

Policy: Cambodia Industrial Development Policy 2015 – 2025.
Policy_Content: The long-term Vision for Cambodia for 2030 and the Rectangular Strategy, Phase III have pointed out to the structural transformation of Cambodian economy in reaching a middle-income country status and have considered the industrial sector as a key driver of its economic growth. To this end, the Royal Government (RG) has prepared and adopted this Industrial Development Policy (IDP) as a guide for driving the development of the industrial sector in the country, which can contribute toward maintaining a sustainable and inclusive high economic growth. Policy: Act amending Act on the protection of agricultural land.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments and addenda to Act on the protection of agricultural land. The present Act defines new principles of protection of agricultural land. It is forbidden to: (a) pollute agricultural land by incorporation of substances, preparations or organisms into agricultural land the amount of which exceeds the precautionary values; (b) cause the erosion of agricultural land; (c) use agricultural land for non-agricultural purposes without consent to withdrawal from the agricultural land fund; (d) damage physical, chemical or biological properties of agricultural land by compaction, wetting, drying, overlaps or erosion. The supplemented sections establish provisions on: uses of sediments on agricultural land (Sec. 3a); acquiring and recording information on the quality of agricultural land and recording of agricultural land withdrawal (Sec. 3b); procedures for pollution of agricultural land or endangered agricultural land erosion and remedial measures (Sec. 3c).

Policy: Law of Georgia on Planning and Coordination of National Security Policy (No. 3126-IIS of 2015)
Policy_Content: This Law determines the areas of the national security policy, the process of planning and coordination of the policy and the authority of agencies that coordinate the policy planning process. The national security policy is an activity carried out to ensure the state interests of Georgia, which implies activities to detect, identify, assess, evade and prevent threats, risks and challenges existing on the domestic level or abroad. For the purposes of this Law the areas of the national security policy are state defence; external security; internal security; social and economic security; ecological and energy security; information security; and legal order. The area of ecological and energy security includes detection, identification, assessment and prediction of ecological and energy threats, risks and challenges; ensuring compliance of the use of natural resources with the goals and objectives of the national security policy; development of appropriate mechanisms to protect population and territory from emergency situations of natural and technogenic character; mitigation and liquidation of impacts caused by natural and man-made disasters; ensuring capacity building of the Emergency Response Forces and coordination of their activities; ensuring safety of the management of harmful waste; implementation of the energy policy in compliance with the goals and objectives of the national security policy.

Policy: Rangelands and Forages Resources Development (Rationalization) Act of 2015.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 21 articles divided in VI Chapters aims at (i) promoting the pasture land being a public natural resource; (ii) addressing the ravages that have a negative impact on its quality and quantity (such as fires, deforestation, overgrazing and expansion of unplanned agriculture); (iii) reducing the lack of adequate coordination between the bodies concerned with natural resources and the absence of an integrated plan to exploit the land; and (iv) avoiding the devastating environmental effects caused by erosion of the soil and the desert encroachment on the areas of pasture and agricultural land and the associated social shocks. Responsible body is the General Directorate of Pasture and Feed at the Ministry of Livestock, Fisheries and Range. The following are the pasture lands according to this Law (1) designated for improvement, study or investment purposes; (2) exploited jointly; (3) intended for specific purposes; and (iv) cultivated pastures (art.4).
