Policy: Council Regulation (EU) 2015/322 on the implementation of the 11th European Development Fund.
Policy_Content: Having regard to the Partnership Agreement between the members of the African, Caribbean and Pacific Group of States (ACP countries) on the one part, and the European Community and its Member States, this Regulation lays down provisions for implementing the 11th European Development Fund. It is stipulated that geographic cooperation with the ACP countries and regions shall be founded on the objectives, basic principles and values reflected in the general provisions of the ACP-EU Partnership Agreement. The primary objective of cooperation under this Regulation shall be the reduction and, in the long term, the eradication of poverty. Cooperation under this Regulation will also contribute to: (i) fostering sustainable and inclusive economic, social and environmental development; (ii) consolidating and supporting democracy, the rule of law, good governance, human rights and the relevant principles of international law; and (iii) implementing a rights-based approach encompassing all human rights. The achievement of these objectives shall be measured using relevant indicators, including human development indicators, in particular Millennium Development Goal. The Regulation sets out the general framework for allocating funds and for related programming.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decision No. 269/QD-TTg approving the master plan on socio-economic development of Bac Giang province through 2020, with a vision toward 2030.

To bring into full play all provincial potential, advantages and resources and mobilize and effectively utilize external resources for rapid and sustainable development; to step up the economic restructuring and growth model renewal, regarding quality, productivity, efficiency and competitiveness as top priorities; to concentrate on depth-first growth, creating a driving force for development in order to narrow the gap between the province and other provinces in the region and the whole country. To harmoniously combine economic development with social progress and equality; to constantly improve the people’s living standards. To promote the human factor, attaching importance to the development of high-quality human resources; to combine economic development with social issue settlement and environmental protection. To combine the development of the driving-force zone with the development of the midland and mountainous region, striving for the target that the development gap among areas in the province is narrowed. To develop the production with higher and higher scientific and technological level; to step up the application of scientific and technological advances and clean technology. To mobilize and effectively utilize all resources for development. To create favorable conditions for all types of enterprises to develop rapidly and harmoniously; to encourage the foreign-invested economic sector to develop under the master plan; to create an equal and transparent competitive environment. To closely combine socio-economic development with maintaining national defense and security, building the all-people defense posture in association with the people’s security posture, ensuring social order and safety based on consolidation of material facilities and forces, and building a solid defensive zone which ensure active defense in any circumstances. To enhance the association in development with other provinces in the region and the whole country as well as international integration.

Policy: Directive (EU) 2015/412 of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 2001/18/EC as regards the possibility for the Member States to restrict or prohibit the cultivation of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in their territory.
Policy_Content: Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) for cultivation must undergo an individual risk assessment before being authorized to be placed on the European Union market in accordance with Annex II to Directive 2001/18/EC, taking into account the direct, indirect, immediate and delayed effects, as well as the cumulative long-term effects, on human health and the environment. The present Directive updates those rules by allowing Member States to restrict or prohibit the cultivation of GMOs in their territory. Pursuant to new article 26a, as from 3 April 2017 Member States in which GMOs are cultivated shall take appropriate measures in border areas of their territory with the aim of avoiding possible cross-border contamination into neighbouring Member States in which the cultivation of those GMOs is prohibited, unless such measures are unnecessary in the light of particular geographical conditions.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Order No. 174 of the Minister of the National Economy validating Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for edifices and constructions intended for production.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes sanitary and epidemiological requirements for projecting, construction, reconstruction and operation of buildings, premises and facilities for industrial purposes, to workplace, working conditions, domestic services, medical care and nutrition of staff. It also sets terms and conditions for heating, lighting, ventilation, air conditioning, water supply, sewerage and recycling of industrial waste. Each construction project of industrial facility shall require mandatory issuance of sanitary and epidemiological inspection report. On the territory of the industrial facility shall be allocated the following functional areas: (a) production/manufacturing; (b) administrative; (c) transport and warehouse; and (d) auxiliary facilities. Storage of highly toxic substances, precursors, pesticides under sheds or under the open sky shall be prohibited. In the premises for storage of highly toxic substances, precursors and pesticides shall be provided natural and mechanical supply of input-exhaust ventilation. Use warehouse space for the joint storage of pesticides with food, fodder and various materials and objects for economic purposes shall be prohibited.  The joint storage of pesticides with mineral fertilizers shall be prohibited. Placement of pesticides inside the warehouse is made according to their classification by toxicity and flammability, preparative forms, chemical compatibility and temperature storage. In complete isolation from other chemicals must be envisaged storage of magnesium chlorate and chlorate chloride calcium. Transportation and shipment of pesticides shall be authorized in solid, well-closed packaging that meets specifications. Container shall be labelled with indelible paint.

Policy: Law No. 187-V “On the protection of the national intangible cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations in the field of protection of the national intangible cultural heritage of the Turkmen people and is aimed at realizing the right of citizens of Turkmenistan to access to objects of the national intangible cultural heritage and the responsibilities of each person to take care of the preservation of the national intangible cultural heritage. Individuals, with the unique ability to create, store and transfer objects to other generations national intangible cultural heritage in unchanged traditional forms and unchanging traditional means can act as carriers of the national intangible cultural heritage. The carriers of the national intangible cultural heritage can unite both in groups and in communities consisting of groups and (or) individual carriers, according to interests (areas of manifestation of the national intangible cultural heritage). Intangible cultural heritage on the territory of Turkmenistan can manifest in the following fields: (a) oral traditions and forms of expression, including language as a carrier of the national intangible cultural heritage; (b) knowledge and skills related to traditional skills; and (c) knowledge and traditions related to nature and universe. Traditional knowledge and skills related to nature and universe shall include then following national intangible cultural heritage: (a) national hunting and fishing; (b) agricultural experience, including cultivation of local plant species; (c) stockbreeding, including experience in breeding of horses, sheep, cattle, camels, dogs and other animal species; (d) methods of obtaining dye from local plant species; (e) methods of use of medicinal plants; and (f) water collection and conservation methods. The goals of this Law shall be as follows: (a) protection of the national intangible cultural heritage as part of national cultural heritage; (b) conservation and revival of the objects of the national intangible cultural heritage which determine uniqueness of Turkmen people; and (c) ensuring equal access of all categories of the population to the national intangible cultural heritage. Objects of the national intangible cultural heritage shall be inserted in the National register of national intangible cultural heritage of Turkmenistan.

Policy: Decree of the Regional Government No. 80-P “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.  Decree of the Regional Government No. 80-P “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1867-OZ “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers, advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government, public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

Policy: Decision No. 260/QD-TTg the master plan on socio-economic development of Thai Nguyen province through 2020, with a vision toward 2030.
Policy_Content: This Decision approves the master plan on socio-economic development of Thai Nguyen province through 2020, with a vision toward 2030 with the following principal contents in conformity with the national socio-economic development strategy, the national green growth strategy, Vietnam's sustainable development strategy, the master plan on socio-economic development of the northern midland and mountainous region, as well as sectoral master plans. The socio-economic development will be mainly based on internal resources associated with external resources, bringing into play comparative advantages, creating spearhead products and motive-force areas to accelerate economic restructuring, raise growth quality and economic competitiveness and ensure sustainable development. To materialize the objectives of industrialization and modernization, consolidate and raise the province's position in the northern midland and mountainous region and the whole country. To uphold the human factor and attach importance to developing high-quality human resources; to realize social progress and justice in each step of development. To support the comprehensive development of remote and deep-lying areas and ethnic minority areas; to preserve and bring into play traditional cultures of ethnic minorities in the province. To closely combine socio-economic development and environmental protection and sustainable development, enhance economic linkage with other provinces in the region and around the country; to promote international economic integration. To build a strong political and administrative system, strengthen national defense and security and firmly maintain political stability and social order and safety.

Policy: Anti-corruption strategy for the period from 2015 to 2020.
Policy_Content: This Strategy, based on the provisions of article 81 of the Constitution of the Republic of Croatia, represent the Anti-corruption strategy for the period from 2015 to 2020. The aim of this strategy is to prevent corruption, i.e. to manage its risks in public administration, local and regional self-government units, public bodies, companies in which the state and local and regional self-government units have ownership shares, the private and non-profit sector. This will be achieved through: increasing the integrity, accountability and transparency of public authorities (central and local); strengthening anti-corruption mechanisms in public authorities; stronger cooperation between public authorities and strengthening the capacity in charge of implementing activities aimed at fighting corruption; effective detection and suppression of corruption; consistent and effective implementation of the existing legislative framework in the field of combating and preventing corruption; establishing procedures for managing corruption risks in public authorities; strengthening public awareness of the causes and consequences of corruption and the role of each individual citizen in the prevention of corruption; strengthening the role and cooperation with civil society in the field of combating corruption; developing international cooperation in the field of fight against corruption; strengthening the active role of the media in fostering personal and professional integrity. The Strategy also recognizes the membership of the Republic of Croatia in the international initiative "Partnership for Open Government" since January 2012, with which Croatia has shown determination in efforts to increase the quality and efficiency of public resource management by implementing measures in fiscal transparency, access to information, use of information technology and citizen participation in policy-making.

Policy: Nuclear Liability and Compensation Act (S.C. 2015, c. 4, s. 120).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to civil liability and compensation for damage in case of a nuclear incident. In particular, the Act strengthens the compensation and civil liability regime for damages that result from a nuclear accident and increases a nuclear operator’s liability for damage from $75 million to $1 billion designates “nuclear installations” and their respective liability amounts maintains that no person other than the operator is held responsible and accountable to the Canadian public for nuclear incidents that cause damage, and for which an operator is liable under this Act. Furthermore, the Act applies to nuclear facilities designated as nuclear installations. These include: nuclear power plants, nuclear research reactors, nuclear material processing plants facilities used to manage nuclear fuel waste and other radioactive waste. However the Act does not apply to facilities such as uranium mines, refineries using natural uranium, and hospital nuclear laboratories. The text consists of 80 sections.

This Management Committee aims at performing the following activities: exercise superior coordination, approve and monitor the development and implementation of the Plan of Action provided for in article 4 of this Decree; define the area of ​​coverage of the Riparian Forests Programme, without prejudice to that already included in paragraph 2 of article 4 of this Decree; define the priority areas for intervention to be considered in the Plan of Action, without prejudice to that referred to in paragraph 4 of article 4 of this Decree; periodically evaluate the results achieved by the Plan of Action, contributing to the adoption of the necessary measures to the full achievement of its objectives; disseminate the results achieved by the Plan of Action. The Annex shows the geographical limits related to the Area of Coverage and the Priority Areas of Intervention of Riparian Forests Programme.
Subject: Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret n° 2015-215 du 25 février 2015 relatif aux conditions et modalités d’agrément des groupements agricoles d’exploitation en commun et portant diverses dispositions d’adaptation réglementaire.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée une nouvelle procédure d’agrément des groupements agricoles d’exploitation en commun (GAEC) dont la délivrance est confiée au préfet. Celui-ci peut consulter pour avis la commission départementale d’orientation de l’agriculture, dans le cadre d’une formation spécialisée restreinte dont la composition est proche de celle de l’ancien comité départemental ou régional d’agrément, lequel est supprimé.  Le décret est pris pour l’application des dispositions des articles L.323-7, L.323-11, L.323-12 et L.323-13 du code rural et de la pêche maritime.

Policy: Regional Law No. 10-OZ “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be performance of plenary powers of regional state bodies in the sphere of regulation of land relations. Regional Legislative Assembly shall be responsible for: (a) law-making in the sphere of land relations; (b) governance of public land; (c) establishment of case of allotment of public and municipal land free of charge to some categories of citizens; and (d) establishment of the modalities of land valuation. Regional Administration shall be responsible for: (a) implementation of the unified land policy; (b) public land tenure and governance; (b) establishment of lease fee for public and municipal land with undelimited ownership; (c) land expropriation for public and municipal needs; and (d) land survey, mapping and cadastre valuation of land.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 118 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Agricultural Land Act, B.E. 2558 (2015).
Policy_Content: In this Act “land consolidation” means the complete development of all plots of agricultural land to increase production and reduce production cost by consolidating several plots of land in the same area to reorganize the lands, arrange irrigation system, construct roads or transportation routes on farms, level the ground, nourish the soil, plan the production and distribution of agricultural produce. There shall be a committee called the "Central Land Consolidation Committee " composed of ministers and Government officers. The Committee shall: consider proposing the land consolidation master plan to the Council of Ministers for approval; set policy of, and consider approving the plan and budget of, agricultural water management projects and of land consolidation projects; propose to the Minister of Agriculture and Cooperatives for issuance of a notification designating an agricultural water management survey area; propose to the Minister of Agriculture and Cooperatives in enacting a Royal Decree designating a land consolidation survey area; grant approval for designation of any land as public domain of the state for common use by the people or for use specifically for the benefit of the state or land reserved or restricted; stipulate rules or regulations concerning expenditures, disbursement and keeping of money of the Land Consolidation Fund; etc. The Central Land Consolidation Office shall have the powers and duties to proceed with agricultural water management, land consolidation, be responsible for administrative work of the Central Land Consolidation Committee, and supervise the Provincial Land Consolidation Offices for implementation of this Act.

Policy: Acuerdo Gubernativo Nº 60-2015: Reglamento de Evaluación, Control y Seguimiento Ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento establece los lineamientos y procedimientos para propiciar el desarrollo sostenible del país en materia ambiental, mediante el uso de instrumentos que faciliten la evaluación, control y seguimiento ambiental de los proyectos, obras, industrias y actividades. En particular se determinan los posibles impactos ambientales y se orienta el desarrollo de dichas obras y actividades en armonía con la protección del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales. Asimismo se establecen sanciones y multas en caso de violación de estas disposiciones.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 5 “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers, advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government, public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 51 validating Forest plan.
Policy_Content: The Governors decrees that Regional Forest plan shall be mandatory guiding document for state forest management bodies at all levels. Forest plan contains characteristics of the state of forests, classification of forests by categories and forest species. It also contains information on the amount of timber extraction, forest fire protection arrangements and pest control measures. Decree sets forth the main directions of forest management, forest protection, and afforestation and reforestation arrangements. Forest plan also contains assessment and evaluation of economic efficiency of forest management.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 2.276 - Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 29.894, Estructura organizativa del Poder Ejecutivo del Estado Plurinacional.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Nº 29.894 en el sentido de incorporar nuevos incisos a los artículos 58 y 62, los cuales tienen por objeto las atribuciones del Ministro/a de Hidrocarburos y Energía y del Viceministerio de Electricidad y Energías Alternativas, respectivamente. En cuanto al Ministro/a de Hidrocarburos y Energía, éste/a se encargará de proponer e implementar políticas y programas para el desarrollo de la investigación y aplicación de la energía nuclear con fines pacíficos en todos aquellos sectores que requieran su utilización. Por otro lado, el Viceministerio de Electricidad y Energías Alternativas será responsable de ejecutar programas y proyectos de investigación y aplicación de la energía nuclear en todos aquellos sectores que requieran la utilización de técnicas nucleares y cumplir las funciones de contraparte nacional oficial para todos los convenios y relaciones internacionales en este ámbito

Policy: Planning (General Permitted Development) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.I. No. 70 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Order grants, subject to certain conditions, planning permission for certain classes of development under Part 3 of the Planning Act (Northern Ireland) 2011. Conditions are prescribed in part by regulations 55 and 56 of the Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 and for, among others, so-called EIA development, certain waterworks and development to be carried out on land which is within or affects: (i) a conservation area; (ii) a National Park; (iii) a nature reserve; (iv) an area of outstanding natural beauty. “EIA development” has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015. "Permitted development" includes agricultural buildings and operations.

Policy: Planning (Development Management) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. No. 71 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision for the new development management processes for determining planning applications. In doing so, they put in place the regulatory framework required to implement the development management provisions in Part 3 of the Planning Act (Northern Ireland) 2011. The Regulations, among other things: prescribe the classes of major development and classes of major development that are considered to potentially be developments of regional significance; prescribe the hierarchy of developments; provide with respect to pre-application procedures and schemes of delegation for purposes of the Act (sections 27 and 31). Major development include an “EIA development”, which has the same meaning as in regulation 2 of the Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 and waste management infrastructures including waste water treatment plants.

Policy: Order No. 72 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “Dzerena Valley”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of federal significance “Dzerena Valley” shall be classified as complex (landscape) protected area constituted for an indefinite time period. Nature reserve shall be located in the Transbaikal region. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystems (complexes, landscapes); (b) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species, including rare and endangered animal species; (c) protection of natural habitats and migratory routes of wild fauna species; (d) performance of ecological monitoring; (e) scientific research; and (f) ecological education and educational tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport fishing in Borzya river (for the period from 1 November to 20 July)  and industrial fisheries (except for authorized ; (b) hunting, except for authorized waterfowl hunting in autumn; (c) presence with firearms, pneumatic arms and missile weapons; (d) exploration of subsoil and mining, including soil disturbance; (e) land reclamation and irrigation; (f) clear felling of forest species and collection of soft resin; (g) burning of vegetation; (h) waste disposal; (i) explosive works; and (j) ploughing up (except for ploughing up for forest fire prevention purposes), haymaking, grazing and passage of agricultural animals.

Policy: Order No. 69 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “National park “Samarskaya Luka”.
Policy_Content: The Ministry establishes that state nature reserve of federal significance “National park “Samarskaya Luka” shall have the status of state environmental protection, scientific research and educational institution, which includes ecosystems, natural complexes and areas of historical and cultural heritage value, with the scope of environmental protection, educational, scientific and cultural purposes, and for regulated tourism. It is located on the territory of Samara region. Reserve shall have the following purposes: (a) conservation and protection of unique natural ecosystems; (b) conservation of cultural heritage; (c) ecological monitoring; (d) ecological education; (e) scientific research; and (f) regulated tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of reserve: (a) exploration and mining; (b) soil disturbance; (c) horticulture and gardening; (d) construction of roads and pipelines; (e) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber forest products; and (f) removal of the objects of cultural heritage.

Policy: Order No. 71 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Taganay”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Taganay” shall be Chelyabinsk region of the Russian Federation. National park “Taganay” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging, including water logging, (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sport and artisanal hunting, industrial, spot and artisanal fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (o) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (p) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (q) unauthorized blasting operations; (r) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (s) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (t) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (u) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (v) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (w) ploughing up and application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; and (x) staying with dogs (except for service dogs for guarding territory of the national park), keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Order No. 50/2015 establishing the implementation system of Support Measures 7.4, «Soil conservation», 7.5 «Efficient use of water», 7.6, «Traditional permanent crops», 7.7 «Extensive grazing», 7.9 «Agroforestry mosaic», and 7.12 «Agri-environment support for beekeeping», of measure No 7 «Agriculture and natural resources» of the Mainland's Rural Development Programme.
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 80 articles divided into ten Chapters and 14 Annexes, establishes the implementation system of Support Measures 7.4, «Soil conservation», 7.5 «Efficient use of water», 7.6, «Traditional permanent crops», 7.7 «Extensive grazing», 7.9 «Agroforestry mosaic», and 7.12 «Agri-environment support for beekeeping», of measure No 7 «Agriculture and natural resources» of the Mainland's Rural Development Programme. Supports provided for soil conservation have the following objectives: a) Promote the adoption of beneficial environmental practices; b) Prevent erosion and improve soils; c) Promote the conservation and sequestration of carbon in agriculture. Supports provided for the efficient use of water have the following objectives: a) Promote the adoption of beneficial environmental practices; b) Improve the management of water, fertilizers and pesticides; c) Improve the efficiency of water use by the agricultural sector. Supports provided for traditional permanent crops have the following objectives: a) Promote the adoption of beneficial environmental practices; b) Maintain traditional systems of permanent crops; c) Maintain the plant genetic heritage; d) Preserve the traditional landscapes of the Douro Demarcated Region. Supports provided for extensive grazing have the following objectives: a) Promote the adoption of beneficial environmental practices; b) Ensure the maintenance of extensive modes of livestock production; c) Prevent and improve soil management; d) Promote biodiversity; e) Promote the conservation and sequestration of carbon in agriculture; f) Reduce the conflict between the extensive grazing activity and the need for conservation of the Iberian wolf species. Supports provided for agroforestry have the following objectives: a) Maintain agroforestry mosaics, ensuring the discontinuity of forest areas; b) Prevent forest fires; c) Prevent degradation of soils, water resources and biodiversity.

Policy: Integrated Administration Control System Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance enforces the European Union Regulation (EU) No. 1307/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing rules for direct payments to farmers under support schemes within the framework of the common agricultural policy and repealing Council Regulation (EC) No. 637/2008 and Council Regulation (EC) No. 73/2009. In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to payments made to farmers within the support schemes and the framework of the Common Agricultural Policy. The text consists of 35 sections divided into 10 sections as follows: Sphere of application, competences, definition of terms and communication (1); Common provisions (2); Payment procedures (3); Procedures for small enterprises (4); Procedures for transformation of permanent grassland (6); Hemp (7); Toleration, participation and reporting requirements (8); Penalties (9); Final provisions (10). One Annex is enclosed.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Resolución Nº 034-2015-MINAM ─ Guía para la elaboración de estudios de Evaluación de Riesgos a la Salud y el Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Guía para la elaboración de estudios de Evaluación de Riesgos a la Salud y el Ambiente (ERSA), con el fin de entender las relaciones y causalidades entre la presencia de los contaminantes, las distintas rutas y vías de exposición y los efectos adversos observados en el ambiente o los efectos potenciales que puedan presentarse, considerando lo establecido en las guías de muestreo de suelo y de elaboración de Planes de Descontaminación de Suelos. A su vez, proporciona directrices y elementos técnicos básicos para mejorar el nivel de calidad de los estudios a realizar y uniformizar el contenido de información de los mismos, basándose en lo establecido por las normas que aprueban los Estándares de Calidad Ambiental para Suelo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 242-14-OZ “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of organization, protection, management and cancellation of protected areas of regional and local significance, coordination of possible transformation of federal protected areas into regional ones, and establishes competence of regional state bodies and local government bodies in the aforesaid sphere. Constitution and functioning of protected areas shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of ecosystems conservation; (b) promotion of ecological education of the population; (c) variety of categories of protected areas; (d) scientifically substantiated formation and development of protected areas network; (e) regulation of economic activities within protected areas; and (f) contribution of citizens and non-governmental entities to constitution, protection and functioning of protected areas.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
